results.description:
Italian Film, 21st-Century Style: A Tribute to Rai Cinema

Cinephiles often speak about Italian cinema with great nostalgia for past eras. The fact is, contemporary filmmakers working in Italy are making some of the most impactful, resonant, and awarded movies of this new century. At the heart of many of these films is one studio, Rai Cinema. Celebrating many decades of support for visionary directors, the Rai Cinema catalog is filled with essential titles past and present. This selection of 10 films from the past 15 years gives a strong indication that future generations of cinephiles will look back at this era with nostalgia of their own. Because they are also all recent additions to MoMA’s collection, it is certain that they will be as beautiful to behold then as they are now.

Sacro GRA

2013. Italy. Directed by Gianfranco Rosi.

“After the India of Varanasi’s boatmen, the American desert of the dropouts, and the Mexico of the killers of drugtrade, Gianfranco Rosi has decided to tell the tale of a part of his own country, roaming and filming for over two years in a minivan on Rome’s giant ring road—the Grande Raccordo Anulare, or GRA—to discover the invisible worlds and possible futures harbored in this area of constant turmoil. Elusive characters and fleeting apparitions emerge from the background of the winding zone: a nobleman from the Piemonte region and his college student daughter sharing a one-room efficiency in a modern apartment building along the GRA; a botanist making audio recordings of the interiors of palm trees to detect and then poison the insects that are devouring them like a plague; a modern day cigar-smoking prince doing gymnastics on the roof of his castle, surrounded by the sea of new apartment buildings proliferating around him; a paramedic in an ambulance eternally on duty treating car accident victims along the vast road; and an eel fisherman living on a houseboat beneath an overpass along the Tiber River. Far from the iconic sites of Rome, the GRA is a repository of stories of those at the edges of the ever-expanding universe of the capital city” (70th Venice International Film Festival notes).


Winner of the Golden Lion at the 2013 Venice Film Festival—the first documentary to win that honor. In Italian; English subtitles. 95 min.


http://www.moma.org/calendar/events/1619?locale=en

For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing
Be advised that MoMA members can now reserve tickets 2 weeks in advance.
Everybody, members and not, can reserve a ticket online.

If there's interest let's discuss the film over coffee.  There are two Starbucks within walking distance.

IMPORTANT. READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people. If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it MAY be cancelled. If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation. Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"

results.description:
The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Solidarity Network is organizing a rally to express solidarity with Syrian and Iraqi migrants who are seeking refuge in the United States. The right to seek refuge (or asylum) in another country is an enshrined human right under international law. DSA supports this cause and will be part of the rally. For more info please see this link:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1001786739864398/

The rally will be held right outside Trump international hotel and tower at Columbus circle. We will meet at the DSA national office at 4:00 pm and then head over to the rally at 4:30. The DSA office is at 75 Maiden Lane (Suite 702) between William and Gold Street near the Fulton Street Metro. If you cannot make it to the DSA office, we will see you at the event. Look out for DSA members wearing DSA shirts.

In Solidarity.

results.description: It's the Holiday Season and what better way then getting together for some cigars, cocktails and cheers. This is our last meet for the year and let's make it a good one. We will be at SoHo Cigar Bar, the retro looking smoking lounge of yesteryear. We do suggest to bring your own cigars and take the cutting fee. There is a full service bar here and the lounge area has waitress service. Some good food appetizers here that can be order.  All new members will be introduce to the other members by me. We are always welcome  to bringing guests. It has been an incredible year for our cigar group and we like to end it with a big top showing. So put aside the shopping & decorating and join us for some Christmas cheer. I'll be waiting for you!

In the bitter cold of a land mired in eternal winter, hunters take the shape of wolves to better kill their prey. They stalk the snow-filled forests on paws of deadly silence. Dear Smart Networkers,

Join us for this networking event where you can broadcast your business through elevator pitches, network, brainstorm, and learn about sales techniques to grow your business.

Sales are the life blood of any business. Most small business owners do not have a dedicated sales team and as a result their revenue is constrained by their ability to sell.

Becoming excellent at sales is undoubtedly the paramount skill of owning a small business. It is not hard to learn, and it pays dividends throughout your working life.

In this meetup we will cover:

1.The mindset of successful selling.

2.The three step formula for sales.

3.Effective closing techniques.

We will follow a structured format :

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration

6:15-6:30pm - Introduce yourself to the group in 30 secs elevator pitch

6:30-7:00pm - Interactive educational program

7:00-8:00pm - Connect yourself to your perfect referrals (We will tell you how)


Cost: It is only $20 prepaid, or $30 cash/door.


I am looking forward to meet you all in this insightful evening of networking.

*Check out the video from our last event:

................................................................

What people are saying about our past meet up on Sales:

“I really enjoyed the format. A mix of very useful information as well as interaction with people. I met a variety of people from different background that were all interesting. I am planning to attend to other events from Dr.Kool. - Thanks!”— Jennifer Daure

“completely fabulous. Loved it and very informative”.— Holly Wilensky

“I am very please that I attended this event and look forward to future events. Dr. Kool's presentation was very informative and I found the brainstorming session equally rewarding.”— Walter Elzey

“very good meet up group for small business networking. learned a great deal on improving sales skills as well as met with other small businesses whose services we can use. overall very structured and highly productive event.”— Arti Upadhyay

“As always Dr. Kool and Aditi organized an excellent meetup. Great group of individuals with very interesting and diverse ventures as well as key tips from Dr. Kool to improve sales effectiveness, which everyone can easily adopt.h”— Uday

“Fun, effective, to the point.”— Jacqueline

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. There were also small break-out sessions that forced you to engage in the learning materials, and ended up in absorbing them more fully. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.”— Brian Erickson

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~


 


,, not good for a first time hiker

Hiking Poles, headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries, water and snacks.

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.

We leave right at 6 PM  Don't be late.

+++

Dear Smart Networkers,

Join us for this networking event where you can broadcast your business through elevator pitches, network, brainstorm, and learn about sales techniques to grow your business.

Sales are the life blood of any business. Most small business owners do not have a dedicated sales team and as a result their revenue is constrained by their ability to sell.

Becoming excellent at sales is undoubtedly the paramount skill of owning a small business. It is not hard to learn, and it pays dividends throughout your working life.

In this meetup we will cover:

1.The mindset of successful selling.

2.The three step formula for sales.

3.Effective closing techniques.

We will follow a structured format :

6:00-6:15pm - open networking/registration

6:15-6:30pm - Introduce yourself to the group in 30 secs elevator pitch

6:30-7:00pm - Interactive educational program

7:00-8:00pm - Connect yourself to your perfect referrals (We will tell you how)


Cost: It is only $20 prepaid, or $30 cash/door.


I am looking forward to meet you all in this insightful evening of networking.

*Check out the video from our last event:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lp2d4dX6rtQ

................................................................

What people are saying about our past meet up on Sales:

“I really enjoyed the format. A mix of very useful information as well as interaction with people. I met a variety of people from different background that were all interesting. I am planning to attend to other events from Dr.Kool. - Thanks!”— Jennifer Daure

“completely fabulous. Loved it and very informative”.— Holly Wilensky

“I am very please that I attended this event and look forward to future events. Dr. Kool's presentation was very informative and I found the brainstorming session equally rewarding.”— Walter Elzey

“very good meet up group for small business networking. learned a great deal on improving sales skills as well as met with other small businesses whose services we can use. overall very structured and highly productive event.”— Arti Upadhyay

“As always Dr. Kool and Aditi organized an excellent meetup. Great group of individuals with very interesting and diverse ventures as well as key tips from Dr. Kool to improve sales effectiveness, which everyone can easily adopt.h”— Uday

“Fun, effective, to the point.”— Jacqueline

“Really enjoyed the personalized yet structured atmosphere the organizers created. There were also small break-out sessions that forced you to engage in the learning materials, and ended up in absorbing them more fully. I thought this was the most useful meetup I've been to in the past couple months.”— Brian Erickson

results.description:
Don't miss the chance to be part of NYC's 2016 Creative Tech Week 


REGISTER HERE - Register HERE!

Join the folks at Creative Tech Week 2016 for a free reception on Dec. 10th for digital art, talks, food and drink at a reception from 6-9 on Thursday, December 10. See the 2015 Lumen Prize Exhibition and presentations about digital art organised by LISA. Be inspired!


Matthew Cornelius, Director of NYIT’s Art Media Lab and HIVE (Home of Innovation, Visualization and Exploration)

Interactive Artist Kawandeep Virdee, head of product at Embedly, trustee at the Awesome Foundation and co-founder, New American Public Art

Dr. Nick Lambert, lecturer and historian in digital art and culture in Ravensbourne and the School of Arts at Birkbeck, University of London

Martha Mooke, award-winning composer, musician, music director and pioneer in the field of the electric five string viola/violin

The exhibition and talks are located at our host the New York Institute of Technology's Auditorium on Broadway, 1871 Broadway between 61st and 62nd. Please register on our Eventbrite page to be assured entry.

After Thursday's gathering, you'll have just over 24 hours to apply to be part of Creative Tech Week yourself. With over 200 partners already confirmed (Including the Volumetric Society)  and participation distributed all over the city, you'll want to be a part of this!

Register Here!

Going Social, a brand-new original sitcom about recent college graduates who fall for the sexy world of Social Media and the lure of a big paycheck.

This exclusive first-look event will screen the pilot episode of Going Social  – set to officially debut in January, 2016 – the screening will be followed by a talk-back with stars/creators/producer Tim Gilliss, Greg Fortier and Joseph Pearce. Joining them on stage will be actor Stephen Zuccaro (Forgotten) who plays Liam, the assistant manager who gets no respect and India Choquette (The Perfect Stranger) who plays Chloe, Jesse's jealous girlfriend.

results.description:
This page has images of the openings we will be attending, so if you do not see them and you are........


1) viewing this page on the Meetup app click the description tab to view the list of galley openings.  

2) using an Android mobile browser open your browser's settings menu and click ''Request Desktop Site". 

3) using  Apple IOS then click the desktop site button at the bottom of the page. 

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

Just a little more business...


Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone.  

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE 

That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...


Mark Ryden -Dodecahedron


Paul Kasmin Gallery - 293 Tenth Avenue, between 26th & 27th streets

Toyohiko Nishijima - gods of Japan


Onishi Project - 521 West 26th Street

Richard Finkelstein -Sitting in the Dark with Strangers


http://static1.squarespace.com/static/51009644e4b0aea0734361ca/t/5663670ee4b0288a697c18e3/1449355027685/?format=1000w

Robert Mann Gallery - 525 West 26th Street, Floor 2


Group Show - the tiny picture show

Pavel Zoubok Gallery - 531 West 26th Street

Bill Viola - Inverted Birth


James Cohan Gallery -  533 West 26th street

Erich Woll- Nothing Lasts Forever


Winston Wacher Fine Art - 530 West 25th street

Stefanie Gutheil -The Home of Mr. Peeps


Mike Weiss Gallery - 520 West 24th Street

Hellen Van Meene -  Five

Yancey Richardson Gallery - 525 West 22nd Street 

After the openings (around 8 pm) everyone who would like to continue with the group are welcome to join us at a nearby restaurant (location TBD) for refreshments and general merriment.  

Look forward to seeing everyone

Todd

results.description:
Hi, I'm Maria, and this will be my first event in the Manhattan group. 


The weather will be nice and not as cold as it should be.  We'll start off in the community area directly across the street from:  114 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036.  We'll work our way towards Bryant Park or Times Square. With the temperatures ending that day in the 50's I don't think we need to end in Grand Central Station.  

Limited to: 4 photographers

Price: 55 (based on 4 photographers)

Shooting time:

4 attending photographers: 5 rounds of 5 minute shooting time each photographer.

3 attending photographers: 6 rounds of 5 minutes

2 attending photographers: 5 rounds of 10 minutes

CLICK HERE TO RSVP AND COMPLETE YOUR REGISTRATION

We'll see how it goes and we'll move to different locations. 

The community space I have chosen and its trees are beautifully decorated with holidays lights.  

There is amazing strong light from the adjacent storefronts that will give you a lot of control with lighting. 

Au revoir! 


Maria

CLICK HERE TO RSVP AND COMPLETE YOUR REGISTRATION

results.description:
Join us in North Chelsea at Pushcart Coffee for knitting, crocheting, good pastries, great coffee and craft beer. Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by Janna from EVERLEA TEXTILES. So, if you're a newbie Janna will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.

Instruction here is really laid back and not structured like an actual class.  Janna teaches long-tail cast on and basic knitting and purling stitches for beginner projects like fingerless mitts or a garter stitch scarf. 

For those of you who would like knitting instruction please let me know and be sure bring your own supplies. Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging me (Janna Maria Vallee.)


Pushcart Coffee closes at 8:30pm

PnP would love to see/support your progress at other meetups throughout the month!
results.name: Knitting at Pushcart Coffee with free beginner knitting instruction from Janna

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups.

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Bitcoin Center NYC

25 Cleveland Place

New York, NY 10012

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].

results.description:
You know you’ve got the skills to get the job of your dreams, but do recruiters and employers know that?

Click HERE to buy Tickets

https://youtu.be/iGACbqk88qM

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you: 

*Are you foggy on what your ‘personal brand’ is or what it means to you?

*Does your resume constantly fall into the dreaded job application black hole?

*Do you wish you knew how to capture the attention of employers and recruiters instantly?

*Does the thought of writing or updating your resume cause you needless stress and anxiety?

*Are you unclear on how to distinguish yourself from the competition?

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

At this workshop, you will learn:

*What your personal brand is and the critical role it plays in your career development

*How to cultivate and manage your personal brand smart

*Your resume’s role in your personal brand and a successful job search

*The 4 things your resume must do

*How recruiters read your resume

*The Kick-Ass Resume Code: critical components of a winning resume

*The most common resume blunders to avoid

*How to amplify your SEO and visibility to employers and recruiters

*Resume Hot Seat: A Quickfire Interview with Vicki

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Ready to change your entire approach to how you market yourself to employers, while amplifying and elevating your professional image, value and visibility to them? Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

*Complimentary light snacks will be served*

Early bird online registration- $20

Regular online registration - $30

At the door: $35

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Workshop Host:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career transformation coach and personal branding specialist who helps passion-driven professionals stuck in a rut to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as personal marketing strategist and 'co-pilot' to aspiring career transitioners, helping them to identify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, as well as over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series and a mock interviewer for several university business schools. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com. @rockincareer

Like all our events, this event will sell out ahead of time, and is limited to 40 participants.

The Meetup is sponsored by NY CAREER MEETUP.

NY Career Meetup is a information and networking group that connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events.The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.NY Career Meetup gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers.NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

Connect with Us

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/

https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup

results.description:
So .... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.how_to_find_us: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&hl=en&q=224+West+4th+street%2C+New+York%2C+NY%2C+10014%2C+us

results.description:
Tea and Cheese might have more in common than you think!  Both exhibit dynamic flavor profiles that result from their terroir as well as time-perfected artisanship.  Tea, very much like wine, offers complex tannins that either complement or contrast the characteristics of the cheese. The temperature of hot tea melts the cheese in your mouth and all the nuances of flavor are just so impressively amplified. 

Join us on this exciting journey of tea and cheese that will open up your taste buds to a whole new world of possibilities. 

Expertly Curated by Chef Donovan Tian and 

Tea Drunk
Limited Engagement December 10th, 12th and 13th - 6:00PM and 8:00PM

Reserve your seat today at 
http://tea-drunk.com/pages/cheeseandtea
results.name: Explore the Complex Flavors Tea & Cheese

results.description:
Hey Latin@ Techies!


To celebrate Computer Science Education Week we're hosting a Startup Pitch Competition on Thursday 12/10 at Digital Ocean (101 Sixth Avenue, 10th Floor) 6pm. 

Moderated by Senior Director of Univision, Carolina Valencia.

If you missed our 1st pitch night, here is the recap. 

This event will sell out and space is limited so please <<<RSVP HERE>>> RSVPs on this meetup group will NOT count.

Thanks to all of you that applied to pitch. We’re happy to see the awesome projects we’re all working on. We will be announcing the startups that were chosen on Monday 12/7 (apply to pitch here).

Event: 5 NYC Startups will showcase their latest ideas in front of the audience. Come hear NYC's CTO, Minerva Tantoco, talk about the different initiatives the NYC Mayor's Office of Technology & Innovation has going on, meet some of the VCs, and network with the Latino Tech community. There will be an open bar, delicious food, and prizes for all participating startups! #LatinoTech

Agenda:

6:00pm - 6:30pm Registration & Networking

6:30pm - 6:45pm Welcome

6:45pm - 7:00pm Q & A w/ Minerva Tantoco, NYC CTO

7:00pm - 8:00pm 5 startup pitches

8:00pm - 8:20pm Open Q&A w/ Companies

8:20pm  - 8:25pm Audience voting/VC voting

8:25pm - 9:00 - Winners announced + networking

Pitch Format:

Each startup will have 5 minutes to pitch to an audience of entrepreneurs and tech enthusiasts. After each pitch the VC’s have 5 minutes to give their feedback (they will only have nice things to say…) The VCs will choose one winner and the audience another (every participant gets a prize).

<<<RSVP HERE>>> RSVPs on this meetup group will NOT count.

Our Twitter hanlde is @NYLatinoTech and the hashtag is @LatinoTech, so please share/retweet.

Cheers and saludos from the NY Latino Tech Organizing Team!

------------------------------

Thanks to our partners for their ongoing support Digital Ocean, Tumblr, Swill, HokkuPR & AlleyNYC

------------------------------ 

Follow us to stay in the loop with all things #LatinoTech

Twitter // Instagram // Facebook // Tumblr // LinkedIn // Newsletter

*This event will be recorded*

results.description:
Unorthodox features over 50 contemporary artists from around the world whose work breaks traditions and rules, highlighting the importance of iconoclasm in the history of art.  Over 200 works were chosen which mix forms and genres without concern for previous convention. Numerous works that examine social and political values, religion and humanism, trauma, and identity explore the relationship between the human figure and the modern creative process. It is worth noting that the exhibit title is not a comment on religious Jewish orthodoxy but features individualist artwork which defies the norm.

If you get through this exhibit quickly, a number of other great shows are on display. 


The Power of Pictures: Early Soviet Photography and Film

Becoming Jewish: Warhol's Liz and Marilyn

Masterpieces & Curiosities: Alfred Stieglitz's The Steerage

The Television Project: Picturing a People.

Meet up with us again at 8pm at the entrance to get food/drinks nearby

We look forward to seeing you!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the entrance at 6pm.  We will go inside at 6:15. If you are running late, please look for us in the museum. We will meet up again at 8pm at the entrance to get food/drinks nearby
results.name: UNORTHODOX at The Jewish Museum PAY WHAT YOU WISH

We are currently focused on assisting the new investor. We hope to provide him or her with the network and knowledge necessary to become successful in The Bronx Real Estate market.

The event on December 10th will provide the opportunity to meet with other like minded investors, as well as brokers, attorneys, realtors, CPA's and others, who have made their careers assisting property owners.

During this meeting, our attorney will give an introductory review of New York's Housing Court .

Every real estate investor focused on the local market should know how to successfully navigate the Landlord/Tenant relationship within the New York City legal system.

The Event will begin at 6 pm at Billy's Sports Bar at 856 River Avenue by the 4, B and D subway (next to Yankee stadium).

The cost is $10.00 to attend. All the proceeds will be applied to light appetizers served after the presentation.

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com

results.description:
You know you’ve got the skills to get the job of your dreams, but do recruiters and employers know that?

Click HERE to buy Tickets

https://youtu.be/iGACbqk88qM

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you: 

*Are you foggy on what your ‘personal brand’ is or what it means to you?

*Does your resume constantly fall into the dreaded job application black hole?

*Do you wish you knew how to capture the attention of employers and recruiters instantly?

*Does the thought of writing or updating your resume cause you needless stress and anxiety?

*Are you unclear on how to distinguish yourself from the competition?

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

At this workshop, you will learn:

*What your personal brand is and the critical role it plays in your career development

*How to cultivate and manage your personal brand smart

*Your resume’s role in your personal brand and a successful job search

*The 4 things your resume must do

*How recruiters read your resume

*The Kick-Ass Resume Code: critical components of a winning resume

*The most common resume blunders to avoid

*How to amplify your SEO and visibility to employers and recruiters

*Resume Hot Seat: A Quickfire Interview with Vicki

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Ready to change your entire approach to how you market yourself to employers, while amplifying and elevating your professional image, value and visibility to them? Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

*Complimentary light snacks will be served*

Early bird online registration- $20

Regular online registration - $30

At the door: $35

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Workshop Host:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career transformation coach and personal branding specialist who helps passion-driven professionals stuck in a rut to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as personal marketing strategist and 'co-pilot' to aspiring career transitioners, helping them to identify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, as well as over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series and a mock interviewer for several university business schools. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com. @rockincareer

Like all our events, this event will sell out ahead of time, and is limited to 40 participants.

The Meetup is sponsored by NY CAREER MEETUP.

NY Career Meetup is a information and networking group that connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events.The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.NY Career Meetup gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers.NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

Connect with Us

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/

https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup

results.description:
Co-founded by CTO Mike Johnson and space entrepreneur Jeffrey Manber, among others, the company began in a garage in Houston, was self-funded by the co-founders and today is an acknowledged market leader in in-space services.  For us, it was clear in 2009 that a new era was fast approaching, one where governments would act more like commercial customers and pay for needed space services, and one where space agencies would cease competing against commercial ventures. The result, now seen on the International Space Station, is a robust and growing ecosystem of services that is proving a model for moving into the next generation of space exploration.

NanoRacks three locations: our main shop is in Houston, Texas, near NASA’s Johnson Space Center, the gateway to the International Space Station. Our business development office is in Washington, D.C., and now we have just opened an office in Silicon Valley, at the NASA Ames Research Center.

NanoRacks’ team shares a passion for space, including humanity’s utilization of low-earth orbit. Learn more about the NanoRacks Team.

The exploration and utilization of space is now integrated into the very fabric of our societies. How to leverage more fully the resources required to improve our lives here on earth is the overarching obsession for all us here at NanoRacks.

We hope you will join us in this quest!
results.how_to_find_us: In the mezzanine conference room of the 1st floor of Columbia Startup Lab at WeWork Labs. Call/text Mike at 609-651-9358 if you have trouble finding it. The door is propped open downstairs but don't get caught in the Holiday party going on downstairs
results.name: Operating System of Space:  A #SpaceTalk with NanoRacks

results.description:
President Obama signed the JOBS Act into law in 2012.  Part of the new law would allow small businesses and entrepreneurs to crowdsource capital from the internet.  

Despite being a new law, the SEC dragged its feet on implementing the actual rules that would make the law applicable.  This past October, the SEC finally approved the new rules and this opens the doors for crowdsourcing funds on internet.

What does this mean for you and your startup/small business?

Come join us and find out along with refreshment and an opportunity for networking!
results.name: Crowdsource Funding 101 @ NJ Entrepreneurs Dec. 10 6:15pm

**This event is for WOMEN ONLY**

In this interactive 2-part training workshop, you will learn tips & tools to help you meet Mr. Right!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT FOR THIS GROUP. To attend, purchase ticket here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mrright/

Part 1 - 

• How to stand out and get his attention that makes you feel good about yourself and highly valued and respected by him.

• How to be in the top 10% of all single women who get access to 90% of all quality, available men in NYC.

• A “magical trick” to help you weed out the cheaters, game players and liars.

• How to select and attract the type of man you want to attract… based on your own, personal “Mr. Right” Discovery Process” (you’ll do this exercise in the workshop.)

• If you've been attracting the wrong kind of guys and want to know where quality men are, you’ll be surprised by what you’ll learn during this eye-opening workshop.

Part 2 - 

• Learn personal empowering style secrets that will make you look & feel amazing, no matter what size or shape you are. 

• Discover your best look & style for your unique personality, body type and the kind of man you want to attract.

• Find out how to dress just the right amount of sexy to ignite your confidence within &  become irresistible to the right man.

• Learn 4 simple tips that will make you instantly feel sexier and more attractive… no matter what your body type.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. To attend, purchase ticket here - 

http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mrright/
results.name: How to Meet and Attract Mr. Right in NYC (For 30+ Women) PREPAY ONLY EVENT

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.
results.name: Weekly Japanese Study Group

results.description:
The Hour of Code™ is a global movement reaching tens of millions of students in 180+ countries. No experience needed. Ages 4 to 104.


The Hour of Code™ is a nationwide initiative by Computer Science Education Week and Code.org to introduce millions of students to one hour of computer science and computer programming. 

Join our team at HQ and participate in the global Hour of Code movement with Codecademy NYC where you will have the opportunity to take one our courses with other community members. We plan to conduct the Hour Of Code from 7:00pm - 8:00pm so please arrive before then so you can get your full hour in! :) This is an opportunity to work on a Codecademy course with other folks.

Not in NYC? Click here to find the nearest one to you.

When you participate at your local meetup, you are entered to win a free month of Codecademy Pro! Want another way to win? To enter, Tag #HourOfCode with #Codecademy and/or #CodecademyMeets with a picture or post about your experience.

This is a BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop) event!

Click here to start your Hour Of Code NYC experience!
results.name: Hour Of Code with Codecademy Meetup

We don't teach real estate investing, we CREATE Real Estate Investors. Real Estate Investors. From an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who is in charge of how much he or she makes and has the option to never work for anyone else ever again. •  And much, much more

More Happiness! Want to contribute by helping someone else? We can always use help and encourage everyone to join us.

results.description:
You know you’ve got the skills to get the job of your dreams, but do recruiters and employers know that?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iGACbqk88qM&feature=youtu.be

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you: 

*Are you foggy on what your ‘personal brand’ is or what it means to you?

*Does your resume constantly fall into the dreaded job application black hole?

*Do you wish you knew how to capture the attention of employers and recruiters instantly?

*Does the thought of writing or updating your resume cause you needless stress and anxiety?

*Are you unclear on how to distinguish yourself from the competition?

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

At this workshop, you will learn:

*What your personal brand is and the critical role it plays in your career development

*How to cultivate and manage your personal brand smart

*Your resume’s role in your personal brand and a successful job search

*The 4 things your resume must do

*How recruiters read your resume

*The Kick-Ass Resume Code: critical components of a winning resume

*The most common resume blunders to avoid

*How to amplify your SEO and visibility to employers and recruiters

*Resume Hot Seat: A Quickfire Interview with Vicki

Click HERE to buy Tickets 

Ready to change your entire approach to how you market yourself to employers, while amplifying and elevating your professional image, value and visibility to them? Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

*Complimentary light snacks will be served*

Early bird online registration- $20

Regular online registration - $30

At the door: $35

Click HERE to buy Tickets 


 Workshop Host:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career transformation coach and personal branding specialist who helps passion-driven professionals stuck in a rut to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as personal marketing strategist and 'co-pilot' to aspiring career transitioners, helping them to identify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned multiple years in the music industry, as well as over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Video Series and a mock interviewer for several university business schools. You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how at therockincareercoach.com. @rockincareer

Like all our events, this event will sell out ahead of time, and is limited to 40 participants.

The Meetup is sponsored by NY CAREER MEETUP.

NY Career Meetup is a information and networking group that connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events.The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.NY Career Meetup gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers.NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

Connect with Us

http://www.meetup.com/NY-Career-Meetup/

https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup

results.description:
This time, let's escape from Hoboken for the evening and go to Barcade in Jersey City, a combination bar and arcade with a focus on classic video games and American craft beer. Here, you can enjoy 33 vintage video games, 24 craft beers and microbrews on tap, and good music.

See list of classic games:  http://barcadejerseycity.com/games/

Happy hour specials until 7 p.m., with $2 OFF beer and well drinks, $5 house wines, and the infamous Fisherman’s Brew & Four Roses shot for $8.  There's also a variety of sandwiches and snacks.

Barcade is 3 minutes' walk from Grove St PATH station. Walk north on Newark Ave- it will be on left side of the street.

Hope to see the "regulars" again this month and also encourage newcomers to attend - we are a friendly, fun, and interesting group.

If you can't locate the group, call[masked] 1254.
results.name: Let's take a short trip to Barcade in Jersey City

results.description:
Join your fellow writers twice a month for a Writers Workshop.

In Writers Workshop, Jersey City Writers' active members review submitted work (ie., short stories, poems, scripts, etc.) in advance. At the meeting, we hone our skills and provide direct feedback to each other in a friendly and supportive environment.

JCW Writers Workshop guidelines for submissions:

• You must sign up for Writers Workshop in advance. 
• You must be an active JCW member to be scheduled. 
• Keep feedback constructive and positive

results.description:
Irresistible Change – An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

What is it you want to Change about your Life?

Imagine "YOU":

• Thinner • More confident • Less stressed • Better focused

Imagine You Achieving Your Goal

Imagine You Living a Better Life

If you've got a desire to make that vision a reality, to attain the life, the body and goals you want, then you can join us for an information and experiential evening and start to Learn these skills NOW.

If you want to see, hear and feel new ways to change your relationship, beliefs and habits, then come hang out for a few hours And begin to learn how to use hypnosis+NLP to help yourself and others.

This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing/practicing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.  The skills of hypnosis & NLP are both practical and magical.  These skills are based on the way our brains naturally work.  And they are simple, organic and easy to learn.  Come Join Us!

Each month we will explore the basics &/or different elements of NLP & Hypnosis and we will often close with a group trance.

Newcomers and experienced Practitioners are all welcome.

Your Habits, Beliefs & Behaviors are Patterns some Good, some Bad

Use Your Most Powerful & Hidden Resources & Abilities to create Change

Imagine using all the knowledge, experience, resources and abilities you have NOW, to create better choices.  Perhaps, you’ve seen stage hypnosis shows or read some novel, seem some movie featuring the power of hypnosis.  Well, fiction is fiction, and the folks on stage are specifically chosen by the hypnotist for there ability to be most suggestible.  You might not be as easily hypnotizable as those people, but everyone goes into trance, everyone has the ability to use their imagination and to make change.

If you want to find out how powerfully you can go into trance or make change, Come Join Us!

===================================

Visit website to Learn More

===================================

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

=================================

Train Your Brains: An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

Description of Class:
This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.

Duration: 2 hours

What will you learn?

This is a hands-on class.  Every class is different and we will focus on different aspects of Hypnosis+NLP.  And we’ll give plenty of time to practice these skills.  Examples of some of the things you will learn/practice/experience are:

Experience How to:

* easily and effortlessly hypnotize yourself

* get rid of negative messages you tell yourself

* go deeper into relaxation then you've ever been before

* eliminate or reduce cravings, habits or beliefs

* enjoy better health

* change limiting blocks that have prevented you from reaching your goals

* build amazing positive and resilient states of calm, confidence, happiness and more in yourself & others

*improve rapport and communication

Learn:

* the history of hypnosis & NLP*
* the myths & benefits of hypnosis & NLP
* the signs of trance
* the neurology of breaking old habits and creating new habits
* the master pattern for most changework
* how to take hold of frames, set the context and story
* the power of metaphors
* the use of small shifts in your experience to create massive change

Who is this class for?
This class is for anyone that is for anyone who is curious about hypnosis, NLP and changework and how they can impact their life or the lives of others.

Whats required for this class?
Nothing is required for the class.  Just bring your curiosity, a willingness to explore, to learn and be open to the possibility of becoming massively different in a really good way.

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

Many thanks to our sponsor, breather.com, for use of their awesome space. Check out Breather's network of over 40 beautiful spaces in New York City, where you can work, meet, relax, or even host your own Meetups, on-demand, at breather.com or through their iOS and Android apps.

***** Seating is on a 1st come, 1st serve basis, while there is plenty of floor space, currently there are only 8-10 chairs available. Folks who come later are welcome to stand or sit on the floor. We encourage you to bring a yoga mat or something to sit on.

=================================

Visit website to Learn More

===================================

About Joel

Joel Elfman is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with over 14 years of experience. He has taught NLP and Hypnosis in over 400+ Meetups for thousands of people.

Joel specializes in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He helps to transform old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more.

http://www.joelelfman.com

Visit my website for answers to Frequently Asked Questions about NLP & Hypnosis

*NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) is often called the study of subjective reality, how each individual uniquely experiences, processes and communicates with the world around them. Once an individual's patterns are modeled, the tools of NLP are highly effective in creating change.

Models include Burlesque performers, drag kings and queens, SVA and Pratt model alums, dancers, yogis, and more...

6:30-9:30pm, stay afterward for dinner gratis! Every Thursday afternoon we fire up the crockpot and see what comes of it. Bring desert or fruit if you so desire. Beer is in the fridge, coffee is hot (or cold depending on the season) and the camaraderie is warm.

At the Shoestring Press's new digs (we re-opened in February) 663 Classon Ave between Bergen and Dean in Crown Heights.

Members of the Press pay $10, $15 for non-members, or $10 if you bring a friend.

Also they have  a store stocked with really kool chocolate gifts  which they make in the store  so if your still looking for a unique christmas gift  you just might find it there .. results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Sign up at the front desk and they will direct you to the yoga room

Click the link below to purchase a ticket to this event:


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyac-experience-inside-the-rare-book-room-new-york-academy-of-medicine-tickets-19795074601

Join New York Adventure Club on Thursday, December 10th, for an after-hours tour inside the Rare Book Room at the New York Academy of Medicine. 

With over 32,000 rare books and manuscripts, the collection is full of surprises -- rare books about cookery, botany, natural history, and anatomy are just a sampling of the items that will be on display during this intimate tour.

After the tour, we'll head to The Lexington Social for some food and drinks!
results.name: NYAC Experience: Inside the Rare Book Room @ New York Academy of Medicine

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy: 


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class. 

There will be a Meet-up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class. 

I will arrive around 6:00 PM or before so that I can get a table for us.

I have asked Marie Flavin, Esq. from IPX Investment Property, 1031 Exchange Services, Inc. to present to our group.  She will explain what a 1031 exchange is and how it can help us mitigate capital gains taxes on Real Estate investment properties.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Helen Junda

results.description:
LIVE FREE Clinic NEW BRAIN-MIND PRIMER

THERE IS ONLY ONE THING TO DO/ ONE MOVE TO MAKE TO CHANGE ANYTHING. 

Many people join the self-improvement world seeking INSIGHTS, better ways to cope with problems, or ways of fixing habits that undermine their choices. Did you know there is a "Real science-of-change" and if someone tells you it’s based in psychology-they DON’T HAVE IT. 

Would you like to know what is the missing piece in all of Self Development? You have read the books, watched the videos and attended the lectures. The is real answer is not another philosophy, the real answer is as specific as your genetic code. Do you ever wonder if you might be missing a key piece for creating the life of your dreams? There is another LEVEL beyond the old promises of self-development. Come and find out the Next LEVEL or keep unknowingly investing in the past.

THERE IS ONLY ONE THING TO DO/ ONE MOVE TO MAKE TO CHANGE ANYTHING.

LOCATION

Thursday December 10

Time 7:00 pm To 7:45

Followed by the "DESIGN YOUR FULL SPECTRUM FUTURE" Program

Location: Ripley-Grier 

520 8th Avenue 17 FL 

Between 36th and 37th street 

New York, NY 10018 

Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.

Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor

Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end 

turn right then left to the end of the hall

NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.


Room: 17 M


The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications. 

One small section of James Research Private Library

results.description:
TICKETS ON OUR SITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite (purchased through our site) to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

Information Architecture: How to Make Sense of Any Mess

Presented by Abby Covert, author of "How to Make Sense of Any Mess"</a>


Price: <a href="http://www.designersandgeeks.com/events/information-architecture-make-sense-of-any-mess?utm_source=makesenseofanymess_meetup&utm_medium=meetup&utm_campaign=meetup_nyc">$15 for early birds, $20 for regular


Information Architecture is a practice of making sense. A set of principles, lessons and tools to help anyone make sense of anything. Whether you are a student or professional, a designer, technologist or small business owner, an intern or executive – join this talk to learn how information architecture can help you make sense of your next endeavor.

Abby Covert is an independent information architect living and working in New York City. She specializes in delivering a collaborative information architecture process and teaching those that she works with along the way. She speaks and writes under the pseudonym Abby the IA, focusing on sharing information architecture content with those working within the design and technology communities. She is the author of “How to Make Sense of Any Mess” a book about information architecture for everybody.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: Information Architecture: How to Make Sense of Any Mess

results.description:
Please save the date for our next event on Thursday, 12/10!

Join the NYC Muslim-Jewish Solidarity committee for a community-wide interfaith celebration, discussion, and social action!

We will learn about the Chanukah story and traditions, play dreidel (a Chanukah game) and eat delicious festive food (with both Kosher and Halal options).

12/10 is Human Rights Day, so we have several guest speakers to discuss current human rights issues including Rabbi Burton Visotzky, Director of Interreligious Dialogue at the Jewish Theological Seminary and a representative from Church World Service.

In collaboration with Church World Service, we are collecting donations for Syrian refugees who have resettled in the NYC area! All basic items are needed: toys for all ages, food, house hold items, please bring what you can.

All are welcome, invite your friends!

For a full bio on Rabbi Burton L. Visotzky, visit

http://www.jtsa.edu/Academics/JTS_Faculty/Burton_L_Visotzky_.xml

The Islamic Society of Mid Manhattan is hosting this event as a part of their interfaith program.

In this meetup, we will discuss the art (and science) behind pitching to reporters and how your personal brand can help or hurt you along the way.  Our panel of experts will talk about how a PR pro can improve their personal brand, pitching to bloggers vs. pitching to journalists and systems for strategic pitching.

Some topics to expect...

• Leveraging data and using infographics


• Understanding what bloggers and journalists want to see in a great pitch

• Pitching etiquette

• Strategies for establishing a personal brand


• and more...

Featured Panelists:

Roger Wu, Founder, Coopertize
Stacey Miller, Senior Manager of Journalist Community Engagement, Help a Reporter Out
Bob Geller, President, FusionPR


Hashtag: #NYCPRInnovators



Note: Please make sure your meetup.com information is up-to-date (incl. First & Last names). You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP.

results.description:
For our next and final meetup of 2015, we are pleased to welcome Evan Estola. Evan is Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Meetup.com, where he works on recommendations and other large-scale data problems. 

When Recommendation Systems Go Bad


Machine learning and recommendations systems have changed the way we interact with not just the internet, but some of the basic products and services that we use to organize and run our life. As the people that build these systems, we have a social responsibility to consider how these systems affect people, and furthermore, we should do whatever we can to prevent these systems and models from perpetuating some of the prejudice and bias that exist in our society today. 

In this talk I intend to cover some of the recommendation systems that have gone wrong across various industries, and attempt to provide some solutions for prevention. First and foremost among these is awareness, but approaches involving interpretable models, using ensemble models to separate features that shouldn't interact, and designing test data sets for capturing bias will also be explored.

Many thanks to Meetup.com for hosting this talk, and for providing food and beverages!
results.how_to_find_us: 11th Floor
results.name: When Recommendation Systems Go Bad

Psychic or not - here we go! Can you see yourself performing Tarot card readings on the first sitting? Rest assured - you will be qualified to share your insight as long as your intention is to help the other find positive solutions and see their life with more clarity. 

This is a great opportunity to practice your intuitive skills, learn the ancient archetypes of the Major Arcana - 'great secrets' of Tarot as well as the Minor Arcana, which stem from the 'good old' playing cards, which were used by the Egyptian scholars to read one's destiny.

This gathering is suited for all levels of knowledge about divination and channeling. The renown 'psychic' sense is simply the ability to hone one's regular perception into a more refined and ethereal level of seeing, hearing, and imaging.

results.description:
Explore electronics, coding, and creative technology at our monthly Micro-controller night. We talk about Arduinos, Raspberry Pis, and the other tiny devices we love to use for embedded projects. A laptop with a usb port is recommended in case you want to get hands on with any of the devices.

This event is free for everyone. Please bring a computer with a USB port, ideally bring one or more micro-controllers that you want to work with, or at least a project idea. Please share your ideas in the comments below to inspire others.

Boards are available online, or PM the organizer and they can either get one for you or tell you where they're cheapest online.

MakerBar volunteers will be present to help you with your electronics project or work on their own.

You're welcome to come hack on whatever you'd like, even if it's totally unrelated to electronics entirely. There will be plenty of awesome hackers from our community for you to meet.

The Microcontroller Special Interest Group runs on the second Thursday every month.


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the red MakerBar sign and call to be let in.
results.name: Micro-Controller Special Interest Group

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Play 3v3, 4v4, and 5v5 indoor soccer for an hour on the best turf product in the city.

Everything provided (e.g., EPL ball and pillowy soft pinnies) - including warm and dry-conditions.

Before coming, please read the facility rules here: http://www.thepitchbrooklyn.com/rules/

* No plastic molded cleats and no metal cleats are allowed on the pitch. You can wear rubber-studded cleats, indoor shoes and sneakers.

* Shin guards are also required.

* Cash-only payments this week.

results.description:
Sadly, I must announce that Katherine Daniels has stepped down as co-organizer of MergeSort. I'm very grateful to her for her help getting MergeSort off the ground, and I wish her luck with the rest of her busy life and hope she still comes by when she can.


Moving forward, I'd like to form a committee of members to lead MergeSort with me. A community should be more than one person making unilateral decisions, so I am opening this initial meeting to anyone who has attended at least one of our hack nights.


Time and location tentative and TBD by schedules/locations of people who RSVP, but I'm hoping for second or third week of December.

I hope you can make it!

Anne

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

results.description:
"Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Today, our membership is 260,000 strong. These members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 12,500-plus clubs that make up our global network of meeting locations.

How Does It Work?

A Toastmasters meeting is a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. A typical group has 20 to 40 members who meet weekly, biweekly or monthly. A typical meeting lasts 60 – 90 minutes.There is no instructor in a Toastmasters meeting. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure."

Why should I join?
The Toastmasters program offers many benefits that help people in all walks of life. As a result of participating in Toastmasters, you will:

Increase your self-confidenceBecome a better speakerBecome a better leaderCommunicate more effectively

Membership is affordable – a great value that can change your life that costs less than a dollar a day. Your initial investment:

$20 New member fee $36 Dues for six months, plus any club expenses. (Some clubs may charge a nominal fee in addition to the regular dues for items such as meeting space and club supplies.)

More than 4 million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?
