results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Each Thurs. from 7-9pm  Happiness and Goodness at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

results.description:
A Talk by Dr. Charlotte Wincott of Rockefeller University.

Addiction is a worldwide problem, devastating the lives of those who suffer from it. In 2013, over 15,000 people died from heroin or prescription opioid overdoses in the United States. Addiction is not only deadly, it is also costly; drug-related crime and healthcare expenses cost Americans over 700 billion dollars per year, according to The National Institute on Drug Abuse. Genetics and environmental factors have been shown to contribute to individuals’ propensity to become dependent on drugs of abuse, with few available treatment options. For these reasons, understanding the basic science underlying the trajectory that leads individuals to compulsive drug use and addiction is very important. These issues will be discussed in an engaging talk by Dr. Charlotte Wincott, addiction scientist at Rockefeller University and Vice President of Know Science.

Dr. Charlotte Wincott, Scientist at the Rockefeller University, holds a B.S. degree from Virginia Commonwealth University in psychology and a Ph.D. from New York University in neuroscience, where she studied the role of glutamate receptors in learning, memory, and reward-related behavior. She is currently a postdoctoral research fellow at The Rockefeller University where she is thrilled to have the opportunity to study heroin addiction. As an undergraduate at VCU, Charlotte served as President and Event Coordinator of the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) and was active in her community, spearheading numerous service projects to raise awareness for suicide prevention and domestic abuse. Charlotte also organized a variety of fundraising drives to benefit The Virginia Holocaust Museum, the homeless, and local food banks. Charlotte has been an instructor of chemistry, biology, neuroscience, and psychology and currently teaches at Fordham University in addition to conducting her research studies at Rockefeller. In Charlotte’s free time, she enjoys spending time with her young son Wolfgang and is also a musician, having recorded multiple albums/EPs in her lifetime.

results.name: The Science of Drug Addiction: Human Behavior Under the Influence

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday December 10th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required!

We are excited to invite you to a very special event! 

Paul Ford (@ftrain), software engineer, writer, editor, co-founder of Postlight, and general provocateur of all things world wide web, will speak about the True Nature of Digital Talent: what talent means, how it's created, recognized, measured, motivated and sustained.

Paul will joined on stage by rockstars Stacey Mulcahy (@bitchwhocodes), Anil Dash (@anildash), Chris Wiggins (@chrishwiggins) and more, who will talk about their work in the talent space. n3rdj0y!

Some of you have known Paul for years; some of you found him back in June when you discovered his tome "What is Code?" in Bloomberg Businessweek, which took over the entire publication and was read by millions. For those of you who don't yet know him, make sure to buckle down because it's gonna be quite a ride. 

Check out his column in the New Republic... 


and more awesome pieces on Medium


_How to be Polite

_I had a couple drinks and woke up with 1,000 nerds

We look forward to seeing you on Dec 10th at the New-York Historical Society, where the exhibit Silicon City: Computer History Made in New York will serve as the perfect backdrop for this talk.

This event is made possible by the generous support from our presenting sponsor Silicon Valley Bank and supporting sponsor Postlight.

results.description:
Join the NYC Traveler's Guild for a special travel presentation on traveling and volunteering in Nepal!  In the spring of 2015, Nepal suffered a devastating earthquake that took more than 8,000 lives. Much property and heritage was lost in the disaster, but so much more remains untouched. Despite the negative media coverage, this talk aims to reassure travelers that Nepalis and Nepal remain strong. Most of the ancient monuments, hiking trails, mountains and hills and rivers continue to persevere. 


Despite the devastation Nepal’s reliance on the tourism industry remains a primary source of its recovery. Through this informational talk and discussion, volunteer Emily Young will bring you stories from travellers that have firsthand experience with Nepal’s resilience. The talk will also share hard data to paint an accurate picture of when and where to make your trip.  You’ll receive tips on preparation, budgeting, and navigating the country’s many sites and destinations.

This talk is for anyone thinking of coming to Nepal or anyone interested in simply learning more about this fascinating country. We will be collecting donations for an on-the-ground local charity that is having real impact in its community and welcome attendees to contribute what they can. 

We really hope to see you there!

results.description:
LOOKING FOR AN ALTERNATE PLACE TO MEET.  GOT ANY IDEAS? PLEASE SUGGEST!

Welcome and thanks for joining. This new Thursday meetup is here to support your poetic side. Rather than critique, we will discuss our poetic work; share feelings, and grow as poets or as writers who love being poetic. We will explore how you can be true to your poetic sensibilities and be understood, or not, as may be appropriately applicable and then emphatically, take it to a higher level. Discussion will be on our posted work. We will also look at what others are saying about poetic prose and poetry, as well as the writing of published poets. And help you along to achieve your goals. As with the Monday and Wednesday groups we will be setting goals and discussing the craft. Our agenda is as follows:

7:15 - 7:20 - Chat.

7:20 - 7:30 - Intros.

7:30 - 7:50 - Set writing goals for upcoming week & share potential obstacles and how to overcome them.

7:50 - 8:30 - Discussion of submitted works: One or two writers chosen at preceding meeting will submit. After the discussion, we will determine who will submit for the following week.

8:30 - 9:00 - Craft discussion/poetic brainstorming

9:00 - 9:15 - Talk about group issues, concerns etc. Wind down.

How to post:

You must attend at least one poetic meetup before posting, in order to become familiar the format of the meetings. This is a discussion of your work, not a critique. Discussion is for everyone and should reveal how people receive your work as well as what you intended in writing it.

• Post only if you have been chosen to submit. Post by Sunday. (For critique/thought sharing outside of the meetup format, your work can be posted in "Pages" in menu above, where others can easily find your work.)

• Poetic Prose Length: General rule, 3,000 words max. Should be about 10 - 12 pages. Please advise us if you are interested in posting more so we can make arrangements and be prepared.

• Poem/Poems, a total of 6 pages (TBD). If you would like to read/recite your poem to the group, please inform us beforehand. It may be necessary to post fewer pieces.

• All work should be double-spaced, in 12 pt font, with 1 inch margins (unless aesthetics dictates otherwise)

• Number your pages

• The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

Post in Files under More tab with the following information under Description: Poetic Thursdays/including date; Title of piece; Brief description of concerns you might like addressed (also include in your document) and if you want to read/recite.


*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.

dan

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

Free for members, special discounted $15 Daypass for non-members
FREE for first timers if you RSVP through this Meetup!

($10.25 for harness and shoes)


We'll have special activities and workshops for women right here at The Rock Club!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Bring Your Own Hand Drum and/or Organic Percussion


The Drum Circle is fun & rewarding for all involved. You do not need to be a professional musician to participate in the circle - amateurs and experienced drummers alike can join-in.


We gather to share and create sacred rhythmic space for the intent of healing, self-empowerment and joy. We celebrate this space with tribal rhythms as we honor Fall release and prepare for Winter stillness, recognizing the interrelatedness of all things.


~ This ancient wisdom of sound therapy has been with us all along ~ Music has traditionally been used in healing practices for centuries. Now we have a great deal of scientific evidence to support what the ancients knew instinctively. Sound Can Heal!
results.name: a Drum Circle is an amazing ‘Stress-buster’!

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

results.description:
Join us as we discuss the novel "Day After Night" by Anita Diamant.


Diamant (The Red Tent, 1997) turns her attention to the period immediately following World War II, when Jewish refugees were making their way to Palestine, many in defiance of the British Mandate blockade. Thousands of the refugees were held at the Atlit detention camp far better than camps they had come from, but an internment camp nonetheless. On October 10, 1945, special forces fighters from the Haganah (the underground Jewish military organization) broke into the camp and released 200 detainees. Diamant relates this history through the eyes of four young women with diverse wartime experiences. Shayndel was a Zionist resistance fighter in Poland. Tedi, a Dutch blond, hid on a farm. Leonie served as a prostitute for the SS in Paris. And Zorah was in Auschwitz. Although the history is compelling, the real interest lies in the way Diamant shows these women learning to go on forming new bonds, rediscovering simple daily pleasures, coming to terms with the past.  (Booklist, 2009)

Novels at Night is  a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere.  Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.

results.description:
We are women who OM (OM stands for Orgasmic Meditation, go to onetaste.us to learn more), and we want to tell you our stories. 


(An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. 

And from that moment, everything changed. 

That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the what the world thinks is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world better, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of their journey into Orgasmic Meditation. 

For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Art K.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

results.description:
HAF Sessions feature festival artists and hopefuls at various venues in Harlem. They’re designed to give you a taste of what the festival is about, connect the festival and the community, and give us all an excuse to enjoy the amazing talent around us!

IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO PERFORM AT THE OPEN MIC, CLICK HERE TO SIGN UP!

OPEN MIC SESSION

Meet and perform with some of HAF's[masked] artists in Silvana's underground music stage, hookah lounge/falafel shawarma restaurant, and bar! As is custom, HAF will be doing a special giveaway raffle, and closing the night with a DJ dance party!

Tickets are only $8 in advance.

CLICK HERE TO BUY ADVANCE TICKETS

Where will we meet?

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana to hold seats for group members who purchase tickets. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.


About the Harlem Arts Festival

The Harlem Arts Festival (www.harlemartsfestival.com) produces a multidisciplinary arts festival in June of each year, showcasing local performers and visual artists that inspire and nourish the artistic community in Harlem. Taking place in the newly renovated Richard Rodgers Amphitheater and the surrounding park, the goal of the Harlem Arts Festival is to fuel the prosperity of our neighborhood, and mark the Amphitheater as a world‐class cultural venue. We are interested in presenting artists across genres — dance, music, theater, and visual arts — whose work contributes to the popular dialogue of the Harlem community.
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs, toward the rear of the bar
results.name: Harlem Arts Festival presents HAF Session: Open Mic Night - $8 Tickets!

• Co-Founded A R Capital: Mr C co-founded A R Capitalin 2014 to deploy capital intelligently across MFUs, Hotels, and more. SR Capital is also a vessel for some Hotel deals and notes deals. Mr C co-founded the LLC to purchase a 95-unit apartment building in St. Louis MO. The team is improving the property, repositioning this asset, and ramping cash flow. Mr C gained Realty experience buying, rehabbing, and selling 10 single family homes in St. Louis [masked]). He has completed the purchase & subsequent sale of a Million Dollar home in San Francisco. results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured! 

Featuring:

Andrei Rebrov is the CTO and co-founder of Scentbird. 

Scentbird is a subscription service for colognes and perfumes. Every month we ship to our customers perfume, which they choose using our TruScent recommender, that we've build using 300k unique perfume reviews. That's why our client call us 'Netflix for perfume'. We started september 2014 and have already shipped about 750 liters of perfume.

Andrei's team calls him 'rocket scientist' because he graduated from Aerospace University in Russia. He was working as a software developer for Luxoft and later for Scrumtrek - russian leading agile coaching company as an agile engineering coach. Andrei is passionate about engineering culture, product development, space and video games.

Village Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

results.description:
Hello all,

This is for an event that should be awesome! It's calls JS Open Day and tickets are (free and) available at http://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyc-js-open-day-tickets-19517795251

NYC JavaScript Open Day  is a full day conference about the future of JavaScript and the Web presented by Microsoft Edge in the Microsoft offices in NYC. World-class speakers from the NYC Web Community will speak about all aspects of full-stack JavaScript development. From topics such as WebAudio to creative coding, the latest techniques in Responsive Web Design to what's new in the latest version of Angular 2.0 , come join us and spend a day to expand your skill set and your network.
results.name: NYC JS Open Day (cross-promoted event)

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Sharing out the details on a free one day JavaScript Conference I am organizing that you might be interested in. We have some great speakers and a day of sessions, eats, drinks and good people. Please register using the EVENTBRITE - yes I know that is annoying :)

NOTE: PLEASE REGISTER USING EVENTBRITE!!!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyc-js-open-day-tickets-19517795251


ABOUT

NYC JavaScript Open Day  is a full day conference about the future of JavaScript and the Web presented by Microsoft Edge in the Microsoft offices in NYC. World-class speakers from the NYC Web Community will speak about all aspects of full-stack JavaScript development. From topics such as WebAudio to creative coding, the latest techniques in Responsive Web Design to what's new in the latest version of Angular 2.0 , come join us and spend a day to expand your skill set and your network.

SESSIONS

Responsive Web Design

Description to come....

Speaker: Daniel Mall | @danielmall

Dan Mall is an award-winning creative director & advisor from Philadelphia; an enthralled husband and dad; founder & Director of SuperFriendly; and co-founder of Typedia, The Businessology Show, No Chains, and swfIR. I was formerly Design Director at Big Spaceship, Interactive Director at Happy Cog, a technical editor for A List Apart, and singer/keyboard player for contemporary-Christian band Four24. He writes about design and other issues on Twitter and on his site danielmall.com

The State of the Web

 Description to come....

Speaker: Christian Heilmann | @codepo8

Chris Heilmann  wrote two and contributed to eight books on web development and wrote many articles and hundreds of blog posts for Ajaxian, Smashing Magazine, Yahoo, Mozilla, ScriptJunkie and many more. He also wrote the Developer Evangelism Handbook in use in many companies to coach evangelists. He is currently working with the Microsoft Edge team as a Program Manager for Developer Outreach.

Session Title to Come....

Description to come....

Speaker: Suz Hinton | @noopkat

Suz Hinton is a JavaScript developer who likes to tinker with hardware. A maker at heart, she’s no stranger to minor burns from soldering irons and 3D printers. She's a regular contributor to the open source Node.js electronics scene, and enjoys teaching others how to immerse themselves in the nerdiverse.

Session Title to Come....

Description to come....

Speaker: Jennifer Schiffer | @jennschiffer

Jenn Schiffer is an open web engineer at Bocoup, creator of Make8BitArt.com, and tech humorist. She also organizes the JerseyScript meetup for front-end developers in New Jersey, where she lives on purpose.

Electroknit! - pixel to textile

Electroknit is a craft project to convert graphics into knitted patterns for an electric knitting machine. What does it take to turn a digital image into a physical object like a knitted sweater? The answer is series of image processing operations. As web engineer, we take it for granted displays an image because it is a "digital photo." Let's look at what "a Pixel" is & how you can manipulate for fun with Canvas API & JavaScript.

Speaker: Mariko Kosaka | @kosamari

Mariko is an international speaker who is currently a Javascript developer at Scripto, a company that makes modern television writing and production application. She is the co-organizer of Brooklyn JS and explores programming textiles with JS.

Session Title to Come....

Description to come....

Speaker: Jed Schmidt | @jedschmidt

Jed is a javascript developer based in Brooklyn and is currently the resident web nerd at UNIQLO in NYC.Jed is the guy behind browserver,ramendan, and 140byt.es, and often seen on github, flickr, soundcloud, and twitter.

.  

Angular 2.0, Worth the Wait?

Angular 1.x has held the reigning World Heavyweight Framework title for several years. It has dominated web application development, and for good reason. It is an excellent tool. With React as a major contender for the top spot, is it worth the wait for Angular 2? What will it bring to the table? 

Speaker: Joel Hooks | @jhooks

Joel is a software developer living in Fort Worth, Texas. He's passionate about home educating his 4 kids and all things technology. He's also keeps egghead.io up and running for your learning pleasure!

Interactive Music in the Browser

The browser has become the primary way that many of us listen to music, but streaming services don't take full advantage of the musical affordances of this platform. Imagine if the songs you listened to were different on every play, or changed based on weather, or let you perform along with them. With the introduction of new JavaScript APIs and libraries, the browser is now both a means of music production and distribution, which opens up wonderful new possibilities for creators and listeners.

Speaker: Yotam Mann | @yotammann

Yotam Mann is a musician and programmer who creates open-ended compositions realized collaboratively with listeners. His interactive music pieces includes three Chrome Experiments, a Turbulence.org commission, multiple apps, and an installation with Matthew Dear. Yotam is also the author of the Web Audio framework, Tone.js. 

P5.js

Description to come....

Speaker: Daniel Schiffman | @shiffman

Daniel Shiffman works as an Associate Arts Professor at the Interactive Telecommunications Program at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. He works on developing tutorials, examples, and libraries for Processing, the open source programming language and environment created by Casey Reas and Ben Fry. He is the author of Learning Processing: A Beginner's Guide to Programming Images, Animation, and Interaction and The Nature of Code (self-published via Kickstarter), an open source book about simulating natural phenomenon in Processing.

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

Hello Friends!

This week, we are thrilled to have Avi Muchnick from Aviary and Adobe coming by to share!

Avi Muchnick is an artist and serial entrepreneur based in NYC with a background in business, law, design and programming. His personal mission is to empower others to create. He co-founded and sold Worth1000 and Aviary, acquired by Adobe.


His products have been used by 100 million+ people to make billions of photos more creative. In 2010, MIT’s Technology Review named him one of their “Top 35 innovators under 35."

We'll get a chance to hear all about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

results.description:
WHAT: The Animals’ Battalion in solidarity w/ Sin Zoo against animal neglect in BA Zoo
WHERE: Consulate General of Argentina
12 West 56th Street (between 5th & 6th Aves.)
WHEN: Friday, December 11th, 2015.
TIME: 11 ~ 1pm


In solidarity with Sin Zoo- an Argentine animal rights group. The Animals’ Battalion will be hosting an outreach event outside of the Argentine consulate in NYC. Sin Zoo is involved in a campaign against the Buenos Aires Zoo for its horrifically negligent care of their animals.
The Buenos Aires Zoo is also directly responsible for the deaths of Lara a giraffe who suffocated on a plastic bag, Winner a polar bear who died of heat exhaustion, two sea lions that were forced to perform 15 shows a day, and most recently on Nov. 03, a jack rabbit that literally ran out of the zoo and was killed by a city bus as well as the incarceration and SEVERE NEGLECT (AS IN NOT BEING FED EVERYDAY) of countless animals.


Many of the animals in that zoo exhibit signs of zoochosis- a range of psychological problems associated with animals kept in prolonged captivity. Rocking, swaying, self mutilation, excessive licking, bar biting, pacing, circling, chewing, and neck twisting are all linked with zoochosis, as are abnormal eating habits, such as anorexia.
Fortunately Sin Zoo has a solution- a proposed bill with political backing to shut down the zoo and transform it into a wildlife refuge/sanctuary where animals can roam freely instead of being incarcerated in cells, where animals that can be rehabilitated will be released back into their native environments and going forward a strict policy which will prohibit bringing in animals that are not indigenous to the country (which is what the zoo does).
On Dec. 13 in Buenos Aires, Argentina- Sin Zoo will be hosting un “Abrazo al Zoo” – an annual demonstration with media coverage that seeks to bring the issue of animal incarceration and neglect to the public as well as reforming zoos nationwide. Last year’s event drew in 1,500. This year with a wildlife refuge bill already on the table, the goal is to draw in even more of the public’s support and get this project underway.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1w3pjFhv2eI


This demo is being done outside the consulate to help draw more media attention and awareness to the citizens and government of Argentina as well as to show solidarity with our friends and allies overseas in a most worthy endeavor on behalf of the animals.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion in solidarity w/ Sin Zoo against animal neglect in BA Zoo

results.description:
The tour of Tweed Courthouse includes a discussion of the building's history and architecture. Spaces toured include several former courtrooms and the octagonal rotunda with its spectacular laylight and Roy Lichtenstein sculpture entitled Element #E from Five Brushstrokes [masked]).

Please note that Tweed Courthouse is no longer a courthouse -- today, it is home to the Department of Education and the first floor is occupied by a New York City public school.

Tweed Courthouse is the legacy of Tammany Hall boss William M. Tweed, who used the construction of the building to embezzle large sums from the budget. The building is estimated to have cost between $11 million and $15 million to complete, which was sixty times the original estimate of $250,000; $9 million of that cost was thought to be in graft. Boss Tweed was tried in 1873 in an unfinished courtroom in the building and was convicted of larceny, among many other charges, and jailed. After the Tweed Ring was broken up, work stopped on the building from 1872 to 1876. Construction progressed slowly after the Tweed years, and it was not until 1881 that the building was finally completed.

Please follow this link to make a reservation: http://www1.nyc.gov/site/designcommission/public-programs/tours/reservation-form.page
results.name: Tweed Courthouse FREE Tour!

results.description:
We're still working our way through Kit Eason's F# Functional Data Structures class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the next three modules -- Lists, Pattern Matching and Recursion, Dictionaries, and Sets and Maps, listed below -- plus have some discussion afterwards!

Description

F# is a .NET (CLI) language. It combines functional and OO (Object Oriented) concepts to you let you solve complex problems with simple code. F# is surprisingly easy to learn. This course covers the fundamentals, and is suitable for anyone with basic software development experience.

About Kit

Kit is a senior software developer for an energy trading systems provider. He has also developed software for automotive engineering companies, universities, energy suppliers, banks, and financial services companies. Kit has run many educational and training courses, including evening classes, women's electronics classes and CNC training for engineers. Kit is a regular speaker at SkillsMatter in London, and at various conferences and meetups. He works mainly in F# and C# and normally speaks on F# and related matters.

Lists, Pattern Matching, and Recursion 16m 52s

Introduction 51s

Pattern Matching 10m 15s

Recursive List Traversal 5m 2s

Summary 43s


Dictionaries 22m 5s

Introduction 36s

Dictionary Basics 4m 29s

Using dict for Immutable Style 3m 39s

In-Depth Demo - Mutable Style 3m 15s

In-Depth Demo - Immutable Style 3m 47s

Dictionary and Concurrency 5m 11s

Summary 1m 6s


Sets and Maps 19m 57s

Introduction 1m 16s

Creating Sets 3m 56s

The Set Module and Set Operations 5m 22s

Hidden Mutability 3m 10s

Maps 1m 57s

Choosing Which Lookup to Use 2m 30s

Summary 1m 42s
results.how_to_find_us: Enter from the River St. entrance, and security will send you up. We're on the 8th floor. Once you get in the office, reception will guide you to the room.
results.name: Kit Eason's F# Data Structures class, part 3

results.description:
Join Adorama as we host a live recording of the podcast "We're Getting Better" with your host Bryon Summers. "We're Getting Better" is a podcast that focuses on photographic situations, experiences and lessons, all aimed to grow a community of aspiring photographers. Tune in each week for a new recording and let's get better together. For new episodes, please visit https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/were-getting-better/id1002411744

Bryon Summers is the resident photographer for the number one hip-hop podcast, The Combat Jack Show and host of his own weekly photography based podcast, We're Getting Better. In 2013, Summers moved to New York to work for an ambitious media company. While there he wore several hats serving as an Associate Producer, Director of Photography, and Creative Services Producer he helped create daily content as well as over 10 documentaries. Outside of the 9-5 grind, Summers shot personal photography projects that eventually lead to exhibitions in New York and New Jersey.

Summers took the stage at a CreativeMornings New York event and was bitten by the speaking bug. Since then he has used his experiences in and out of media as topics to share with audiences of aspiring to progress in their respective fields. In addition to creating We’re Getting Better, Summers has held educational workshops at universities and venues.

Bryon is a Maryland native and Brooklyn resident.

Sign up Here

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/podcast-were-getting-better-w-bryon-summers-tickets-19822773449
results.name: Podcast: We're getting better w/ Bryon Summers

results.description:
Macro photography lets you explore and create exciting photographs of a whole new and intimate world. Zeroing-in to create an interesting abstracts or just filling the frame with a tiny flower, insect or a jewel. Close-up and Macro photography is all about producing images that you can't ascertain with your naked eye. Remember, while Macro Photography is the art of creating an image that is the same size as the original, close-up is not necessarily a 1:1 ratio.

In this NJCS class, Shiv Verma will address the challenges you'll face with macro photography and the methods and tools used to overcome those challenges.

We will deal with the lighting and equipment, as well as several techniques to get better images, including:

• Selecting the appropriate equipment

• Positioning yourself to get the shot you desire

• Lighting

• Stacking

• Depth of Field

Participants will learn how to create high magnification images using macro lenses, tubes and diopters. In addition, participants will learn how to create one completely focused image from several partially focused images by combining the focused areas. This technique is ideal for macro photography and landscape photography when sharpness from


CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE AND REGISTER


SHIV VERMA, APSA, MNEC is a published author, photographer, educator and technologist. He has been photographing for over 50 years and has evolved his photography to express his intense devotion to wildlife and nature. Over the years has earned numerous awards and recognition both nationally and internationally.Shiv devotes a great deal of his time formally reviewing photography related products, to education in digital photography and is a speaker and competition judge. He conducts photo tours and workshops worldwide and typically has one tour a month.

Shiv’s book Time-Lapse Imagery was published in February 2014. He has been writing for one of the worlds largest photography education sites “Digital Photography School” with about 1.5 million subscribers. He is also a co-host on TWiP (This Week in Photography) a weekly photography podcast that is the 7th largest in the world.

In addition to nature and commercial photography he has been invited to photograph prestigious charity events; Kelly for Ellie, a charity fashion event by TV’s Channel 5 for the Ellie Fund in support of Breast Cancer; The Rose Foundation – in support of Battered Women to name a few.

He belongs to multiple photographic clubs and associations and serves as Vice President of the Digital Circuit NECCC (New England Camera Club Council), General Chairman of the PSA International (Photographic Society of America), immediate past Chairman of Nature Division, PSA; Director of the instructional and essay sets, PSA; past Member of the Board CIPNE. Shiv is a past President of the Stony Brook Camera Club; and the Gateway Camera Club, a member of the Greater Lynn Photographic Association, Massachusetts Camera Naturalists, all in Massachusetts.

Shiv was elected as an Associate of the Photographic Society of America in 2013 and was elected a Master Member of the New England Camera Club Council in 2008.

Shiv, as the chairperson, conducts the world’s largest nature and wild life photographic competition/exhibition – the Photographic Society of America’s Annual International.
results.name: NJCS: Macro and Close-up Photography: Latest Technologies with Shiv Verma

results.description:
Sugarbush Resort


Sugarbush, located in Northern Vermont's Mad River Valley, is one of Vermont's favortie ski areas. Sugarbush consits of two mountains, Mt. Ellen and Lincoln Peak, and is home to more than 4,000 acres, with nearly 600 skiable acres plus 2,000 acres of backcountry skiing in the Slide Brook Wilderness area. "The 'Bush" has beginner terrain (20%), Intermediate (45%) and advanced to expert (35%) accessed via 16 lifts that provide the area with a 25,463 person uphill capacity. The 23,000 square-foot day lodge features cathedral ceilings, a food court, and the Castlerock Pub complete with an outdoor patio and barbeque area. Timbers, a post-and-beam restaurant attached to the Clay Brook residences, offers upscale cuisine and is open to the public in all four seasons. The Mad River Valley is also home to 38 lodges (6,600 beds) and 19 restaurants for guests to enjoy.


Snow Creek (Closest Condo to the slopes)


These two-bedroom, a sleep sofa, two-bath stacked units are the most conveniently located and are slope-side at the base of Lincoln Peak. 6 persons will share each unit and each person will share a bed. These units offer a fully equipped kitchen, color cable television, fireplace, washer dryer, and balcony. During the summer months, enjoy the conveniently located on-site pool at the Snow Creek complex.


*** Trip plan email will be sent out to everyone confirmed (including those paid by Chase Quickpay) via Eventbrite 2 to 3 days before the departure date providing trip logistics and details. ***


Date/Time: December 11th Friday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.


Depart 3:00 PM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 3:45 PM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 43rd St & 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map) Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Return: Depart from Sugarbush at 3:30 PM on Sunday & get back to NYC around 9:30 PM and Flushing  10:00 PM.

Trip Includes: 2 nights accommodation at Snow Creek based on 6 persons sharing two-bedroom & a sleep sofa unit and 2 persons sharing a bed (Ski-In Ski-Out). 2 days all mountain lift tickets at Sugarbush. Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC & Flushing.

Cost: Early Birds $279 for first 10 spots; Regular $309 for last 10 spots. Self drive is $60 less. Also, additional $60 reduction for drivers for giving each passenger & their equipment/luggage a ride.

Additional Cost: 2 day Rental (skis or snowboard) is group rate $75; Group Lesson at $50.

Max: 20

Buy Ticket Here: http://dec2015sugarbush.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) When Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Refund Policy:


* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 21 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 10 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 10 days; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $20 processing fee.

Pictures from 2014/2015 Trips:

http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/25801108/
http://www.nyskiclub.com/photos/25968380/

Meet on field 8!!!

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Please refrain from bringing large bags, as all items larger than 11" x 15" x 5" must be checked.

Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibition at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


We'll be seeing - - -


Picasso Sculpture on the 4th floor Alfred H. Barr, Jr. Painting and Sculpture Galleries


Picasso Sculpture is not only a sweeping survey of Pablo Picasso’s innovative and influential work in three dimensions; it's the first such museum exhibition in the United States in nearly half a century.


   Above:                                                                                                 • Bull. Cannes, c. 1958 by Pablo Picasso                                     • Plywood, tree branch, nails, and screws, 46 1/8 x 56 3/4             x 4 1/8″ (117.2 x 144.1 x 10.5 cm).                                                       • The Museum of Modern Art, New York. Gift of Jacqueline            Picasso in honor of the Museum’s continuous commitment        to Pablo Picasso’s art.                                                                            • © 2015 Estate of Pablo Picasso/Artists Rights Society (ARS),      New York

Over the course of his long career, Picasso devoted himself to sculpture wholeheartedly, if episodically, using both traditional and unconventional materials and techniques. Unlike painting, in which he was formally trained and through which he made his living, sculpture occupied a uniquely personal and experimental status for Picasso. He approached the medium with the freedom of a self-taught artist, ready to break all the rules. This attitude led him to develop a deep fondness for his sculptures, to which the many photographs of his studios and homes bear witness. Treating them almost as members of his household, he cherished the company of his sculptures and enjoyed re-creating them in a variety of materials and situations. Picasso kept the majority in his private possession during his lifetime. It was only in 1966, through the large Paris retrospective Hommage à Picasso, that the public became fully aware of this side of his work. Following that exhibition, in 1967 The Museum of Modern Art organized The Sculpture of Picasso, which until now was the first and only exhibition on this continent to display a large number of the artist’s sculptures.

Picasso Sculpture focuses on the artist’s lifelong work with sculpture, with a particular focus on his use of materials and processes. The exhibition, which features more than 100 sculptures, complemented by selected works on paper and photographs, aims to advance the understanding of what sculpture was for Picasso, and of how he revolutionized its history through a lifelong commitment to constant reinvention. The exhibition is organized in chapters corresponding to the distinct periods during which Picasso devoted himself to sculpture, each time exploring with fresh intensity the modern possibilities of this ancient art form.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Come see the Baby Bills cohort graduate and demo their FinTech final projects including VALOREM-a news aggregator and analysis tool and Torus described below. See how it will simplify the lives of those in the finance industry.  The demo will be followed by networking and refreshments amongst students, instructors, entrepreneurs and influencers in the tech and FinTech communities.   We will also answer any questions that you may have about Byte Academy coding bootcamp.

About Valorem Final Project represents the concept of making the information gathering process more effective and more efficient.  Conceived from the frustrations faced at a CMBS trading desk of having to quickly research numerous properties for news that may or may not exist on a commercial real estate property, Valorem combines automated Google searches and text filtering procedures to return only those articles that are relevant to “value events.”  Using natural language processing techniques and a clean, crisp view for the user, Valorem offers traders and analysts the possibility of receiving a significantly higher proportion of relevant news articles in a fraction of the time it would take to replicate the same process using traditional manual Google searches.

About Torus Final Project Torus connects young people in the US with development programs to activate productive futures. We’re building a technology solution to increase awareness of and access to programs while giving youth a voice in program evaluation and improvement.

 Babybills' Althea Smith built a database and Django REST Framework API for New York development programs, incorporating PostGIS to enable location-based searches.

About  Byte Academy:

Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python.  Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology).  Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program - recently declared as the highest paid programming language - and the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. 

Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes starting Jan. 19th, 2016!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
This screening will be followed by a Q&A with the filmmakers, which means it will sell out.  Reserve your ticket ASAP!

In Transit 

2015. USA. Directed by Albert Maysles, Lynn True, Nelson Walker, Ben Wu, David Usui.


The Empire Builder is America’s most heavily traveled long-distance train route, running from Chicago to Portland and Seattle. In Transit, a long-held dream project of legendary filmmaker Albert Maysles—as now gracefully realized by a core team of filmmakers—is both a microcosmic portrait of Americans in transition and, for the viewer, an immersion in the “time-out from life” engendered by the three-day journey. As landscapes glide by, passengers speak of new beginnings, reunification with estranged families, making journeys for love, or taking time to reevaluate their lives—all, for the moment, traveling hopefully toward their destinations. 76 min.
http://www.moma.org/calendar/events/1665?locale=en

If there's interest let's discuss the film over dinner at the Thai restaurant across the street.

For admissions and visitor information click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing


IMPORTANT!

Be advised that MoMA members can now reserve tickets 2 weeks in advance, which makes many films sell out a lot more easily. If you are not a MoMA member you can still purchase your ticket online.

If you have a corporate/other membership that grants you free movies at MoMA you will NOT be able to reserve free tickets online. You need to make your reservation in person at the ticket counter at MoMA, or pay full price for an online ticket. .


Films are free on Fridays after 4:00, which is more of a reason to reserve your tickets online beforehand because they are more likely to sell out.  However, know that if you are NOT a MoMA member you cannot reserve an online free ticket for a Friday screening: you will have to pay full price online.  You can get a free ticket only in person, and after 3:45pm.

READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people. If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it MAY be cancelled.
If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation.
Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"
results.name: FREE MoMA FILM - IN TRANSIT!

This is a German Movie Night presented by Goethe Institut. 

It is a public event, there is no specific area for our group.

The language of the movie is GERMAN, but it will have ENGLISH SUBTITLES. 

Finsterworld (2013 - 91min.) - directed by Frauke Finsterwalder

Connecting the lives of twelve lead characters, including a police officer with a furry obsession and a pedicurist all too careful with his client’s dead skin, this is a funny and subtly terrifying portrait of modern life in all its surrealism.

Is there a Cover charge?

No, the event is free.

Do I have to speak German to attend?

No. Just keep in mind that this movie is shown in German, with English subtitles.

4/5/6 & N/Q/R: Union Square - 2 Blocks away

L: 3rd Avenue or Union Square - 2 Blocks away

1/2/3 & A/C/E & F/M: Transfer to L at 14th Street

NORWEGIAN BREAKAWAY NYC PIER 88


Norwegian Breakaway Cruise line December 11-13, 2015

               It’s A Weekend Birthday Getaway Cruise!


Everybody, Lets Just Slip away for a night or two at sea on a weekend getaway. You know, “Just Gotta Getaway NOW weekend!”


Leave all your cares on land and slip away for a cruise to nowhere. Enjoy dinner and dancing, take in a show, win big in the casino, party the night away or spend some time in the spa to relax and rejuvenate. We've got weekend getaways from home-ports around the country, so get on board.

Friday night departures with Sunday morning returns make for the perfect weekend getaway for couples or families or just for YOU.


What is Included?

·  Many dining options, from three-course dining to endless buffets with action stations.

·  Entertainment day & night. Spectacular stage & comedy shows, dance clubs, bars & lounges, piano bars and live music.

·  Fitness center, sports court, pools, and hot tubs.

·  Youth programs for children ages 3-17.

·  Attentive room steward.

We'll be playing funk this season. Join us for a great time playing in this group. We got the funk of Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Chic, Kool&The Gang, George Clinton and more! 

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (All charts will be posted by end of August) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

September 09/05, 09/12, 09/19, 09/26
October 10/03, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31 (halloween, boo)
November 11/07, 11/14, 11/21 (skipping Thanksgiving, Happy Thanksgiving!)
December 12/05, 12/12

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (13 sessions at discount + show fee) for $340  (you save $20)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


SONGLIST is (roughly, a song could be added or removed in a few weeks). Songs will be added over the weeks til November.

SUPERSTITION by Stevie Wonder (POSTED)

I FEEL GOOD by James Brown (POSTED)

JUNGLE BOOGIE by Kool and the Gang

GET DOWN ON IT by Kool and the Gang

SEX MACHINE by James Brown

GOOD TIMES by Chic

WE GOT THE FUNK by George Clinton&Parliament

PICK UP THE PIECES by Average White Band


Show Day is Sunday, December 13th at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in October) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

This show is going to rock!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
Let's go to Kumo Sushi in Scarsdale on Friday December 11th starting at 6pm. I"ll make a reservation for 8 and your $3 will secure your spot. This is a relatively new addition that opened in December 2014 to the Scarsdale dining scene and the buzz is growing! 

Created so artistically it would put Michelangelo's best brushwork to shame, Kumo Sushi Lounge's picturesque dishes delight diners with fresh ingredients and, above all, flavor. 

A spotlessly clean dining room, beautifully back-lit bar and upscale accents create an enticing ambiance inside Kumo Sushi Lounge as skilled chefs busy themselves in the back creating first-class dishes made with fresh ingredients. Nearly anything you could aspire to eat is available on their expansive menu, from Roasted Duck Wraps and Beef Negimaki on the hot appetizer menu to a la carte sushi and sashimi, skillfully crafted rolls and entrees ranging from teriyaki to katsu and tempura. Dinner boxes like the Duck Confit box are a good bet for a full-circle flavor experience, while hibachi dishes delight onlookers with a dinner-and-a-show spectacular. Stop in for a bite and familiarize yourself with Kumo's friendly and efficient staff, not to mention the fabulous food.

Here are some reviews by recent diners: "This is a welcome addition to the Eastchester, Scarsdale, New Rochelle area. Ambiance and Décor are pleasant and most important the sushi was good.  The chefs special rolls were creative as opposed to the same old, same old."

another writes, "I am very picky about sushi, but this place is deff one of the best around! Delicious Rolls and all VERY FRESH!  They have a great happy hour menu where you can sample a variety of items on the menu.  Friendly Staff and nice ambiance make this my go to sushi place in the neighborhood!!"

And one more, "I was there tonight for the first time. Although it was a soft opening and the grand opening will only happen this Monday, I was impressed to see how beautiful the place is and how amazing and fresh our dinner was. We were a party of four and ordered various dishes including spider, Godzilla, rainbow rolls and vegetable yakisoba, among others. Every dish was beautifully presented and tasted delicicious. Service was pleasant and attentive. Also, there is a pomegranate cocktail that's refreshing and mild and for desert we had the tempura ice cream (great to share) .  I will definitely go back!"
results.how_to_find_us: Please find us at the bar
results.name: Let's go to Kumo Sushi in Scarsdale!

results.description:
Holistic Hangout

(typically every 3rd Friday of the month)

Relax, Unwind, Refresh

When climbing the mountain of enlightenment, growth, self-development, healing, and spirituality it can be good to stop and catch your breath.

Share, Connect and Exchange!

Meet fellow seekers off the mat, outside the circle, beyond the classroom.

Rest your 3rd eye

Revive your Chakras

Fill your heart with good company, food and drink.


COME OUT & PLAY WITH US at the WHOLE FOODS CAFE!

Stop by for a little, Stop by for a lot,

Stop by on your way or Stop by and stay,

Stop by for some stimulating conversation and a bite to eat with unique and interesting people who share an interest in the diversity of holistic and alternative news, views and practices. We are experimenting with this new, quieter space with more freedom to mingle, move, chat and exchange.

This is a very casual event.  No agenda, just simple conversation, meet and mingle.

Share adventures, experiences, health tips, intentions and more

Learn about interesting classes

Meet healers, practitioners and coaches

 If you are just beginning to explore or been exploring for a while, we welcome you.  It is amazing how so many people who are attracted find that they have natural abilities of healing, coaching, energyworking or even more amazing skills.

Make Great Connections in an inviting social setting

We Look Forward To Welcoming Back Old Friends & Meeting New Ones Too!

You can Register here on Meetup or on EventBrite

Many Blessings,


Joel Elfman & Michael Balice


***We are often joined by members from several other Meetup groups this event is posted to.
results.how_to_find_us: we'll have some signs out at the tables on the upper level
results.name: Holistic Hangout @ Whole Foods Cafe - Houston St

results.description:
Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because this event is more about socializing and having fun!  It is a great way to spend a Friday evening with dozens of other fun members and friends!

You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, take picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).  At least One person in your group will need to have a camera.

Can I come alone?  YES! 95% of those attending will come on their own.  If you come alone we will randomly set you up on a team.

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle tavern for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

Her is how it works:  Arrive at Old Castle Tavern between 6pm-6:30pm, enjoy a cocktail and get set up on a team (if you already don't have one)  Once you have a complete team we will send you out to the museum to find all the clues.

What am I looking for at the museum?  All the clues are things that are already at the museum.  It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people that are there! Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible.  The teams with the most points will win prizes.  Don't worry if you didn't answer all the items because there are bonus points.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time


Cost $15 general admission Please bring exact change

What's included?
- Admission to MOMA
-Private reception with drink Specials at the bar
- A fun way to visit the museum
- A unique way to make friends
results.name: MoMA Multi Group Scavenger Hunt

results.description:
Lets share some more dreaming - and do a little  catching up as well...

Please note the importance of your RSVP to our planning - and feel free to email any questions-

By member request we are going French Bar again - We have a reservation for 6:15 in case anyone wants to order the prix fixe menu dinner before 6:30 - The Oyster happy hour prices are good til 7, and the bar menu is all night i believe... 6:30 is okay -anything later please email me?

And for next meetup we will try a nice place in Chelsea, maybe Merchant's by the fire? (Email suggestions and requets.)

What's the title of the dream you'd most like to share?  Come and share a little Summer refreshment-

Looking forward to catching up with old members and meeting new -

Email me any time - Thank you and see you soon, Michelle

results.description:
Friends,

Join us this Friday, December 11, for our Friday After Work party @ Skyroom Rooftop. This venue is conveniently located near Times Square. You are guaranteed to have a fun time at this rooftop.

Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Skyroom is one of the best rooftops in NYC! 

This event is from 6:15pm -10pm.

Admission is free for all members. Just mention Rory's List to the door person upon arrival.

Dress code is business casual.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Don't forget to RSVP if you would like to join us.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends and colleagues.

We look forward in seeing you this Friday.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
Jamie has a beautiful girlfriend, a fulfilling job. He should be happy. But a meeting with a childhood acquaintance that throws a troubling light on his past undermines his certainties, deepening existing fault lines in his relationships and shaking his sense of self.    Herzog gently, humorously, but unflinchingly explores how memory eludes, deludes, and shapes us all. Come for the reception and stay for the reading and a discussion of the ethical issues of the play

Matt Antar  Carole Chamlin  Jennifer Ruth  Ben Sumrall  Betsy Ungar Tom Weishaar

Come at 6:30 for the reception, and stay after the play for a discussion of the ethical issues it raises.  Come at 6:30 for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar. Playreading starts at 7 pm..

These tend to be excellent with an interesting discussion of the ethical issues afterward. Please note: there is a requested donation of $10 (which I think from past experience is more than just optional, so I would plan on paying $10 if you attend) and the reception is normally not a meal....so I highly recommend eating supper before attending.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be greeting folks by the food reception table, I look a lot like my photo! :-)
results.name: Playreading and Ethical Discussion: The Great God Pan, by Amy Herzog

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!
results.how_to_find_us: http://imeditateny.org

For a free psychic reading send in your question via the Sadulu House website or call into “The Enlightenment and Transformation” broadcast Friday’s at 6:30pm and HRU will provide you with a reading on the spot! Go to Blogtalkradio.com/Enlightenmentandtransformation at 6:30pm.
