results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

group.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

Coastal shrimp Curry (Shrimp with coconut, cooked with aromatic Indian spices

Kashmiri lamb Kabob (Minced lamb with marinated masala) Mung Lentil curry (Small mung lentil cooked with peas and coconut)

Dahi Okra (Okra cooked with onion, ginger and yogurt masala)

Pulao (Basmati rice with carrots, peas, onion and cashews)

Essex County

Hustle Dance Instruction6:30pm Registration (optional)

Meet 'n Greet7:15pm

Friday Dance Party & Social8:00pm to Midnight 

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

click venue name above for directions

111 Prospect Avenue, West Orange, NJ 07052 
( bordered by Eagle Rock Reservation to the east )

*

Hustle Dance Instruction

by Matt

Registration 6:30pm -- Instruction 7:00pm to 8:00pm  

Meet 30 dancers at the instruction, a great icebreaker as you rotate partiners! Mix with 120 more new faces at the Dance and Social.

No partner needed. Tonight's class is for Beginner and Intermediate level dancers.  Accomplished dancers are always welcome to polish their skills and to meet new faces

*

Meet 'n Greet7:15pm
Come Mix and Mingle; our Party Hostess will introduce you to new friends.


*

Friday Dance Party & Social

8:00pm to Midnight.

 "Mix, Mingle and Dance" in The Dôme Nightclub. PBSN's DJ will be spinning the hottest dance tracks of yesterday and today all night long! Come meet new dancers! Singles and Couples; all are welcome, expected median age 55. Introduce your friends to PBSN tonight in an elegant and sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere.

*

Premium wines available by the glass ... Cash bar.


*

Dress to Impress:
The Manor requests business casual attire, jackets are preferred. 
No jeans, no sneakers, no shorts, no t-shirts.

 *

Guests, Friends, and Walk-ins are always welcome.
Membership is not required.

*

The Dôme, originally designed for but never integrated into the White House during the Benjamin Harrison administration [masked]), was adapted for The Manor and added to the West Orange landmark in 1975. 

Experience the grandeur of the Spiral Stairway and newly completed Two Story foyer on your way up to the Dome Nightclub.

  *

PBSNinfo.com<----- click for more event listingss

  QUESTIONS: Call Ralph  [masked]

results.description:
There's a diversity of high quality art in the streets that surround the infamous Gowanus Canal. This walk highlights the most interesting art studios and spaces, placing them in context with their unique environment... a 150 year old industrial waterway inching towards recreational use. Property developers are making moves following the opening of the new Whole Foods Market in the center of the neighborhood, and they utilize art in surprising ways.

No tour is ever the same. Each one is carefully curated, and spiced with insight direct from the community. Enjoy a new side of New York's creative culture from the comfort of this shabby-chic enclave. The tour ends among excellent food and drink options, and near public transport.

More info and tickets here: https://goo.gl/WH8akB
results.name: Happy Hour Street Art Tour Through Brooklyn

venue.name: Outside the main entrance of Century 21, near the red awning and street clock

results.description:
Let's visit the extravagent, world-famous Christmas displays in the wealthy Dycker Heights section of south Brooklyn, recently voted the best neighborhood in America for holiday lights. Residents hire professional decorators to build a fantasy world of dazzling lights, sculptures, and other phantasmagoric creations sure to thrill your inner child. We'll grab a bite afterwards at an inexpensive restaurant if you wish. 


PLEASE READ THE DETAILS BELOW, SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.


DISTANCE: About 2.5 miles

PACE: MODERATE, NOT SLOW. IF YOU WANT TO WALK SLOWLY, THIS IS NOT THE RIGHT EVENT FOR YOU.  

ENDING TIME: Around 8:30 PM for the lights, 10:00 for dinner.

COST: $2, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee. Optional dinner: Probably $20 or less, including tax and tip but not drinks.

TRANSPORTATION: R train to 86th St. Exit near intersection of 86th and 4th Ave. Turn right at top of stairs, then walk about 2/3 of a block on 86th to Century 21. For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since the above sites do not always list the ideal routes.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a red cap. You can wait inside if it's cold but we'll gather outside at around 6:40 and leave at 6:45.
results.name: Amazing Christmas lights in Dyker Heights--possible late dinner, too!

results.description:
Come have a glass of wine, and learn fun ways to create beautiful handmade card projects. The cost for each class is $20.00 which includes 3 hours of class time and a kit of all the paper supplies needed to create your Make and Take copy of each project. Bring your favorite adhesive (tape runner, wet glue and/foam pop up tape.)

We will start out the evening with a look at each sample of the ready-made projects for the night. I will show you step by step how to construct each. You then get your chance to play with Stampin’ Up! products and learn about the tools and supplies that are used in the world of card making and paper crafting.

By the end of the evening, once you have finished your glass of wine and completed your projects, you will get a supplies cheat sheet listing the sizes, dimensions, stamp sets, dies and tools used during the class.

You also get an Exclusive YT web address to a video demo - all projects in one YT video that only class attendees can access.

Need more information please feel free to send me a message.

Card Making 5 Session Series:.

Wednesday ... September 23rd : Basic Paper, Layers & Backgrounds

Friday ... October 23th : Die-Cuts & Punches

Friday ... November 13th : Inking & Dry Embossing

Friday ... December 4th : Wet Embossing & Stencils

Friday ... December 18th : Fancy Folds & Interactive Cards

Join in the whole series or come for the class that grabs you.
results.name: Well Wishes & Wine Card Classes

Friday Night Futsal

Please wear futsal/indoor shoes or regular flat bottom sneakers.


$10 for one hour or $15 for two hours per player!!

NOT ALLOWED:

-Slide Tackles

-Unnecessary Contact

-Unnecessary Trash Talk


We are here to enjoy the game not to argue or fight!


Once you RSVP please show up!!


Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have :)

**By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit to participate in this game. You voluntarily release NYC Futbol from any and all liability resulting from your participation and/or receipt of instruction.

If you are intrigued by the flavors, healthy benefits & healing properties of Indian spice, if you would like to learn how to cook healthier, lighter, with better flavors, if you would like to cook without the cream and heavy oils that many Indian restaurants use then check out this cooking class!

The menu includes:

Coastal shrimp Curry (Shrimp with coconut, cooked with aromatic Indian spices

Kashmiri lamb Kabob (Minced lamb with marinated masala) Mung Lentil curry (Small mung lentil cooked with peas and coconut)

Dahi Okra (Okra cooked with onion, ginger and yogurt masala)

Pulao (Basmati rice with carrots, peas, onion and cashews)

results.description:
As you are all aware of the flood of epic proportions that has hit Chennai and neighboring villages which has affected 1.8 million people including many of our family members and friends in and around Chennai. A lot of them do not have access to basic necessities including food, drinking water, shelter, clothing, baby products, blankets, etc. Further there is major shortage of medicines and vaccinations to prevent epidemic. While we doing our best sending funds for their immediate needs we still need a lot of help from all quarters. We are organizing a Karaoke night event at Mumbai Spices on Friday, December 11th at 6:30 pm. It will be great if you could help support the cause. Please RSVP if you can attend the event and also forward to others who will be interested in attending.

We have Special South Indian Buffet with Idli /Vada / Dosa / Avial / Porial / Payasam / with Chicken65, Chettinad Chicken /Thalappakattu Biryani etc.,

results.description:
Okay, so we lied. It's not really coffee but tea. Nevertheless, it is a great way to sit and talk about dating in New York. This is a perfect excuse to sit among others and discuss the battles of being single in New York. This was a great twist to get together without the loud music, over multi-tasking bartender and plenty of sweet goodness without the excessive caffeine. We hope to have a group of 30, come and visit and have a bubble tea and make friends with people who endure the busy schedule and single life in the greatest city, like you. 

There will be some questions and topic discussion. We do not want a large group. However, we do want a fun one. This is part of our table discussion. 

After work week event.

How will you be able to find us. I will have a pink notebook on the table and a lot of friendly, smiling people

Argo Tea             Great Article on: "Why They love Loose Tea"


Brought to you by EWNYC 

See you soon, 

Olisa

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

151 West 26th Street 6th Floor New York, NY 10001

results.description: The December meeting of the Staten Island Geological Society, Inc. will feature a National Geographic Video on “Bizarre Dinosaurs”. While dinosaurs may have been some of the mightiest creatures to ever have walked the Earth, some have been among the most bizarre with exaggerated body parts and outlandish appendages. Why did some of these animals ever adopt strange body parts, what was their purpose, and why did these evolutionary changes die out?  Join world-renowned paleontologists to unearth some answers to some of the lesser-known but surprising members of the dinosaur family. This meeting will take place on Friday, December 11, at 7:30 PM in the Father Hicks Center at St. Clare's School, 151 Lindenwood Road, Great Kills, Staten Island, New York [masked]). The meeting is free and open to the public. For further information call:[masked]-5786.

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

When one sees a high master like Effie Chow at work, who can clear an energetic blockage in minutes, one understands the importance of knowing this system consciously. Anton will guide class participants in a systematic learning of the channels of the hand and foot until all are experienced. We will learn two-three channels per evening such that one feels and understands how they affect health. Practical exercises are interspaced with theory and we will practice immediately what we learned in class during the ensuing bioenergy healing offerings.

NOTE: Following a one hour presentation, the Edgar Cayce Healer’s Group practitioners will offer Bioenergy Healing to all who attend the evening and request it. Occasionally Anton’s events will have guest speakers as part of a course and announced changes as karma dictates. One can attend separate classes as each presentation stands on its own and some recapitulation always occurs. Handouts or electronic material will be distributed as a part of a course.

Cost $30

results.description:
Join us for our annual photowalk after work to capture the beautiful holiday lights in Midtown Manhattan. The price for this event is = $FR.EE!!  :D


We will meet inside of the Chase Bank on 34th Street and 5th Avenue at 7pm sharp.  Nearest subway is 34th and 6th (B, D, F, M, N, Q and R).

If you are driving, do not use the meetup map! Use Google Maps instead. Parking will be difficult to find close by, as it will be crowded and streets closed from traffic.


 This will be a very short photowalk!!!  The plan is to stop by Herald Square and Bryant Park.  If you want to check out the 6th Avenue Display, and the tree at Rockefeller Center, you can venture to those spots on your own. 

WARNING: The weather will most likely be brutal.  I've hosted holiday walks in the past and some people have complained and left the walk early.  PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU ARE PROPERLY DRESSED FOR THE WALK!! IT WILL BE VERY COLD!!!!!!!!!!!!

Also, there will only be one bathroom break at Herald Square.  You can use the bathrooms in Macy's or if you walk west on 34th Street you can use the bathrooms at Old Navy. Of course along the way we can stop at an open Starbucks or other shop for coffee, tea or hot chocolate.

• Night photography and long exposures are always better with tripods, just be aware that the area is filled with tourists and high security.  If you have a strong, table-top tripod or gorilla pod, those would be handy.  

• Don't forget your charged batteries and empty memory cards. 


• As always, please be on time. Allow yourself enough travel time and check the MTA for any subway updates. I won’t be able to take calls and messages after the meetup starts.

• Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are.


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927)

********************

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

(6:30pm reception - light refreshments) suggested donation $5 members, $10 non-members

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of The Great God Pan, by Amy Herzog

Directed by Susanna Frazer

Jamie has a beautiful girlfriend, a fulfilling job. He should be happy. But a meeting with a childhood acquaintance that throws a troubling light on his past undermines his certainties, deepening existing fault lines in his relationships and shaking his sense of self.  Herzog gently, humorously, but unflinchingly explores how memory eludes, deludes, and shapes us all. Come for the reception and stay for the reading and a discussion of the ethical issues of the play

Matt Antar  Carole Chamlin  Jennifer Ruth  Ben Sumrall  Betsy Ungar Tom Weishaar

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
December's caller is  Luke Donforth, who hails from Vermont, brings a warm and inviting playfulness to the stage. He is also known to bring chocolate truffles to sell at regular dances. Enjoy the rich smoothness of hand-crafted truffles.

The band, Party of Three, brings together three musicians from diverse musical backgrounds who share a depth of experience playing for dancing. Combining high energy Scottish and Cape Breton fiddle music with Latin and Funk influenced piano and drum grooves, Party of Three has been enthusiastically received by dancers across the mid-atlantic and northeast. Members include Lilly Pearlman on fiddle, Neil Pearlman on piano, mandolin and banjo, and Joe de Paolo on drum set, doumbek and bodhran. 


Contra dancing is a great way to have fun, meet new people, burn a few calories and let loose all the stress of the week!

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.


For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.

(6:30pm reception - light refreshments) Suggested donation $5 members , $10 non-members

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of The Great God Pan, by Amy Herzog

Directed by Susanna Frazer

Jamie has a beautiful girlfriend, a fulfilling job. He should be happy. But a meeting with a childhood acquaintance that throws a troubling light on his past undermines his certainties, deepening existing fault lines in his relationships and shaking his sense of self.  Herzog gently, humorously, but unflinchingly explores how memory eludes, deludes, and shapes us all. Come for the reception and stay for the reading and a discussion of the ethical issues of the play

Matt Antar  Carole Chamlin  Jennifer Ruth  Ben Sumrall  Betsy Ungar Tom Weishaar

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Come watch Mustang with YWTF and stay for casual discussion and networking afterwards! A great film about female empowerment that scored 97% on Rotten Tomatoes!

After the movie, we'll grab coffee together at the Grey Dog (49 Carmine St - map)

Admission: $14 - you can buy online or at the box office

Summary:
Early summer in a village in Northern Turkey. Five free-spirited teen-aged sisters splash about on the beach with their male classmates. Though their games are merely innocent fun, a neighbor passes by and reports what she considers to be illicit behavior to the girls' family. The family overreacts, removing all "instruments of corruption," like cell phones and computers, and essentially imprisoning the girls, subjecting them to endless lessons in housework in preparation for them to become brides. As the eldest sisters are married off, the younger ones bond together to avoid the same fate. The fierce love between them empowers them to rebel and chase a future where they can determine their own lives in Deniz Gamze Ergüven's debut, a powerful portrait of female empowerment.
results.name: Movie Viewing & Discussion - Mustang

Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Listed among  Time Out New York's  Top 10 Christmas shows to see this Holiday Season

Sometimes, we forget or are not in the mood for Christmas. For some who may be grieving, they just want to get the 'season of painful reminders' over with.  

Maybe, it is the extreme early commercialization of the season starting in October or maybe it is the global media coverage of Life's Really Really BIG Question:

"Why does the Coffee Cup not have a Christmas Tree on it?

Regardless of whether you are totally into or totally not into the Christmas Season, this show may help to provide us all with a glimpse of Christmas past and how others who were not so worried about the Christmas Tree on the Coffee Cup, but about..... 

About "Our Friends the Enemy: The 1914 Christmas Truce": 

Show's Website: http://www.ourfriendstheenemy.com/nyc/4581847728

To get your Tickets: https://www.telecharge.com/Off-Broadway/Our-Friends-The-Enemy-The-1914-Christmas-Truce/Ticket?&PerformanceDateTime=12/11/2015%208:00%20PM

Listed among  Time Out New York's  Top 10 Christmas shows to see this Holiday Season, for a strictly limited two week engagement OUR FRIENDS THE ENEMY will make its long awaited American debut at The Lion Theatre, at the famed Theatre Row on West 42nd Street.

After London acclaim and sold out houses at the Edinburgh Fringe and during two triumphant UK tours, OUR FRIENDS THE ENEMY arrives in New York City for a strictly limited two week engagement at Theatre Row from December 8-20.

The Western Front, Christmas 1914.

British and  German soldiers stop their fighting, emerge from their trenches and meet between the firing lines.

The events that follow are the most astounding stories of the Great War told through the eyes of one soldier.

Private James Boyce takes us on a magical, haunting journey through the remarkable Christmas Truce.

Speaking at the centennial event last year, Prince William said the truce was a 'message of hope and humanity even in the bleakest of times.' He added:  'It is vital that 100 years on, we keep the Christmas Truce story alive.'
results.name: THEATER: Our Friends The Enemy: The 1914 CHRISTMAS Truce

results.description:
Its Michael Dorian's B-Day and he has asked us to come and celebrate it with him.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Indoor Soccer Facility with Real Turf Right by Prospect Park (Elevator available for bike riders)

FUTSAL In the Morning Before Work, During Lunch and Late Evenings

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. Start time Vary So stay Tuned and look out for the time slots that suit you best

Real Turf, Please wear flats. 2 flights upstairs from entrance door or take elevator to 3rd floor

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

For those who attend meet ups a lot, we will be charging a $50 Monthly fee and you can attend all the meet ups you like, we will Definitely have every Tuesday & Thursdays 7-8:30PM & Fridays 8-930 PM Weekend slots will Vary & Monday, & Wednesdays  will be added once we get more members attending.

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ.


<a href="http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/faq"></a>

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson w/ Shira and Naomi

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson w/ Shoshi and Jeff

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Flouer and Jeanette

Full class descriptions can be found here.


**************************************************************

If you saw the demo that Shoshi and Jeff did last week, then you saw the way they ooze creativity by playing off of one another. Check out this description of their November Intermediate series, which they'll be continuing this week:

The Intermediate series for the month of November is called "Dynamic and Creative Social Dancing: Evolving Ideas Over Time." What Shoshi and Jeff love about dancing together is how they continually inspire each other to dance creatively, resulting in an entirely unique dance experience every song. In this series, we will explore what it means to be a dynamic and creative social dancer, and how to keep your dancing fresh and interesting every time. You’ll learn some cool new moves and ways of connecting to your partner that naturally lend themselves to creative modification, and become comfortable using this vocabulary on the social dance floor. We’ll give you some specific tools to add more creativity and dynamics to your dancing, and teach you to apply those tools through evolving your ideas over time, and choosing singular moments to make one larger change for major impact. In addition, you will learn to apply these tools to your existing dance vocabulary so you can express and explore your unique dance personalities.

Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

**************************************************************

Before you come in, it’s a great idea to take a look at this Etiquette Document that our community has compiled: http://bluesdancenewyork.com/etiquette


**************************************************************

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night!

Volunteers get in for FREE for the night! Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

If you see or experience anything that would be considered harmful activity or a breach of etiquette, please speak with our Manager. The Manager on Duty this week is Melissa S Cohen.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks 
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay by friday at 3pm, I have no choice but to open the spot up for the people waiting to play, so please be fair to them and 'own' the spot, thanks!

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
Maybe i'll teach one of these moves as a bonus this coming friday:

But What a great class we had last Friday. We had 25 ladies and gents and they all went from not knowing the basics to knowing it, to learning how to turn, and then dancing with everyone after the class. This coming Friday, we will review the basics again and then I will add a cool new turn for you guys to do when you social dance. I love it when people dont think they can learn and boom, they know it after the class.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris unless there is an invited instructor. Here is silvio In action:

results.description:
Another great class, another fun night. In just 1 hour, beginners learned the fundamental steps in Salsa, learned how to turn, learned partner dancing, and practiced after the class. Let's do it again, but this time, I will teach a fun turn that you can use for social dancing.

 Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

results.description:
Emergency Response Diver Training

OpenWater Dive Weekend

• 2 Days four Dives


• Click for Equipment list Bring and Extra SCUBA Cylinder each 

• Printout and Bring your academics

ERD 1 Diver
This entry level Emergency Response Diving course is designed to give the public safety diver the fundamental skills needed to safely function as part of a public safety dive team and is OSHA and NFPA compliant. Topics such as problem solving, tender skills, search patterns and evidence handling are covered just to name a few. Dive skills include executing search patterns, victim recovery, emergency procedures and decontamination procedures among others. ERD I also serves as a prerequisite to ERD Ops Components courses. ERD 1 Divers are cross trained as Tenders

Call Phil[masked] or <a>Email</a> for details

Toll Free 1.877.SCUBA.USA

See more info on our websitehttp://www.1877scubausa.com/public_safety.htm
results.name: ERDi Public Safety Diver Open Water Dives

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Economic and Wealth Creation Conference & REIA NYC End-of-Year Award Recognition Ceremony

Saturday, December 12, 2015 - Sunday, December 13, 2015
From 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM 

 
TRYP By Wyndham Hotel, 345 West 35th Street. New York, NY 10001

General: $99  (expires December 8, 2015)

We are bringing together some of the WORLD''S LEADING REAL ESTATE EXPERTS, LIFE COACHES, THINKERS AND DOERS to equip YOU with EVERYTHING you need to SUCCESSFULLY... ...create, manage, protect, and grow wealth. 

Get ready to JUMP-START and EXPAND your mind and EXPLODE your WEALTH step-by-step! What is the Wealth Zone Economic & Wealth Creation Conference? The Wealth Zone Economic & Wealth Creation Conference is a joint partnership between Dr. Teresa R. Martin, Esq., REIA NYC, Generational Wealth Zone and Strongbrook REIC which teaches the rules of wealth creation, how to protect it and generate passive income over the long-term. 

Our Economic & Wealth Creation Conferences, the ideal opportunity to network with REIA NYC, Generational Wealth Zone and Strongbrook Qualified Experts, receive in-depth real estate and business training, and sharpen your skills to promote your Real Estate Business. This amazing two-day training will provide you with:

Day One: An entire day of dedicated real estate, mindset mastery and wealth training supported by some of the most knowledgeable and successful leaders. 

Day Two: A second day of dedicated money mastery, business and system training taught by some of the most successful leaders in your region. Get up close and personal with our coaches so that you can really learn what you need to! We have a great lineup of speakers who will provide you with solid market information, future opportunities and all the material you need to make your real estate portfolio and business grow.

The American Problem & Solution

results.description:
Let's get a head start on that New Year resolution the HVH way! The New Year promises a new beginning, but there’s no need to wait to start making positive changes. Change can happen at any time, all it takes is a little push and the desire to live a healthy life.
The HVH is a very active group and your hiking possibilities are endless. Here is a great place to start getting in shape. We will be ascending the Major Welch, taking in the views and socializing at Perkins Tower, then descending on the AT. Bring a snack and beverage of choice to enjoy during the break. We will meet in the main large parking lot closest to the Inn. We will be leaving at 8:00am. This hike is a short distance however is a challenging hike and will get your heart pumping. It is a lot of elevation in a short distance. We will keep a slow and steady pace. You can download a copy of the map: NY- NJ Harriman Bear MountainTrails #119
http://www.avenza.com/pdf-maps/store Minimum 2 liter of water, hiking poles and boots are strongly recommend. Distance: about 4 miles round trip

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: approx 2:30 hours

Feel free to message me if you have any questions. Let's get hiking! HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Intro to HVH- Bear Mountain Beginners Hike

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Build your own IoT Solutions with Hardware and Software! 

Get IoT Certified!

Case Studies for Logistics & Home Automation 

Starting Date :  12th December, - 5 Days IoT Expert Live Online Training with Hands-On    

</a>

<a href="http://axelta.com/AxOnlineIOTBootcamps.php">Click here to Download Brochure 

You know why every big company is rushing to adapt IoT in their business?? , why so much Hype around IoT??

Because IoT is the FUTURE.

IoT is applicable everywhere and in every filed of science. It's for everyone.  IoT has unlimited opportunities for Innovation, Jobs, Business, Hobby and Research. Every one of us can find the fit in this new boom. 

We Invite you join us and give your career a boost in this technology revolution.

The Training covers all aspects of IoT like:- 

• Understanding IoT and it's business

• End to End IoT Architecture

• Sensors and Embedded Systems 

• Hardware & Software Platform for IoT

• All network protocols for IoT (to connect devices)

• Cloud, Web Services, Big Data, Big Data Analytic and Visualization

Ted Corbitt 15K

results.description:
Meet time: 8:45A. M..   

Start time:9:00A.M. promptly 

Location: 179th Street and Fort Washington Ave. adjacent to the Port Authority 

After debuting with the 36 mile perimeter walk around Manhattan, the URBAN HIKING SERIES continues with the 16 bridge walk in which we will cross every bridge that accesses the island of Manhattan in a 30-32 mile trek that will also take us through parts of The Bronx, Queens and Brooklyn. Along the way, we will cross the mighty( the George Washington Bridge) and the mundane ( the 103 rd Street Foot Bridge) , through neighborhoods which many of us have never been to or even know exist. 

We will start on the NYC side of the GW(1) and cross back and forth before heading north up the west side along the Hudson River before crossing the Henry Hudson Bridge(2) and entering the Fieldston section of The Bronx. 

We will then criss cross the between the various neighborhoods in The Bronx and Manhattan as we make our way south across the remaining Harlem River Bridges(3-10). At the Triboro Bridge(11), we will head down into Randall's Island/Ward's Island. 

Since this is close to Riker's Island prison, I will try to time our arrival to coincide with visiting hours for those of you with friends and family incarcerated there. Just joking.

We will then cross the 103rd Street Foot Bridge(12) back into Manhattan and then proceed along the East River until the 59th Street Bridge.(13). After crossing into Queens, we will make our way across the Pulaski Bridge-doesn't count- into Brooklyn until we reach the Williamsburg Bridge(14) which will take us back into Manhattan. We will continue downtown until we reach the Manhattan Bridge(15) which we will take back to Brooklyn and then the Brooklyn Bridge (16) back into Manhattan. The estimated time of the hike is about 10-11 hours. 

There will be 2-3 minute water breaks about every hour and a lunch break at about the halfway point. We had a nearly 80% completion rate for the 36 miler, so if you come with your legs, heart, and mental commitment you should be able to finish and be rewarded with a very fulfilling experience.

-----------------------------------

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. 

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: *URBAN HIKING SERIES - 16 Bridges of NYC* 32 mile walk around Manhattan-

results.description:
I've done this hike many times in the summer, when the sun is out and the weather is warm. And the park is full of so many people you'd think you were in Times Square if it wasn't for the occasional snake slithering across your path or porcupine foraging for food in the bush next to you. Still, this is one of my favorite treks. Let's get out and tackle what is arguably the most scenic hike in the Northeast--Gertrude's Nose in the Shawgunks Mountain Ridge--when it has a bit of a different look, in the early winter when the trails are empty and the solitude makes it feel like you are the only person within 10 miles. Beautiful.

We're going to follow carriageways and hiking trails to six different breath-taking overlooks. Our journey will take us through dense hemlock forests, over streams, and make us marvel at the crags and crevasses of the Shawgunks Ridge which has extraordinary beauty in its combination of pale, high cliffs and dwarf pines. We'll make our way to the apex of our hike -- Gertrude’s Nose -- a unique geologic formation that looks like the prow of a great ship, with massive blocks of fallen rock below. Witnessing nature’s glory from this special place, overlooking the long rocky ridges and sweeping valleys below makes life worth living.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an INTERMEDIATE hike of about 8.5 miles. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape as this is one of the more challenging treks in area with a bit of elevation gain and a few rock scrambles. We will be out all day so leave your afternoon/evening open.

• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• This is COLD weather hiking. Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat and gloves, bring 2-3 liters of fluid (something hot in a thermos is good), a packed lunch and/or snacks.

• Traction devices are recommended. If you don't know what those are, ask. I don't anticipate encountering wintery trail conditions this early in the season but better to be prepared.


• There is a parking fee of $10.00 per car.

• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

• RSVP only if you seriously plan to attend as space is limited.

How To Get There ...

Take the New York State Thruway to Exit 18 (New Paltz). After paying the toll, turn left onto Route 299 and continue west through the Village of New Paltz. When you cross the bridge over the Wallkill River at the west end of the village, continue ahead on Route 299 (do not turn right towards the Mohonk Mountain House). In another 5.5 miles (from the Wallkill River bridge), Route 299 ends at a T intersection with Route 44/55. Turn right here and follow Route 44/55 as it negotiates a very sharp hairpin turn and climbs to pass under the Trapps Bridge (a steel overpass). Continue for about three miles past the Trapps Bridge to the entrance to Minnewaska State Park, on the left side of the road. A parking fee of $10.00 is charged at the gatehouse. Continue uphill for 0.4 mile to the parking area at Lake Minnewaska, the UPPER one nearest the lake.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where), If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

We'll make our way to the apex of our hike -- Gertrude’s Nose -- a unique geologic formation that looks like the prow of a great ship, with massive blocks of fallen rock below. Witnessing nature’s glory from this special place, overlooking the long rocky ridges and sweeping valleys below makes life worth living.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an INTERMEDIATE hike of about 8.5 miles. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape as this is one of the more challenging treks in area with a bit of elevation gain and a few rock scrambles. We will be out all day so leave your afternoon/evening open.

• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• This is COLD weather hiking. Dress in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat and gloves, bring 2-3 liters of fluid (something hot in a thermos is good), a packed lunch and/or snacks.

• Traction devices are recommended. If you don't know what those are, ask. I don't anticipate encountering wintery trail conditions this early in the season but better to be prepared. 

• There is a parking fee of $10.00 per car.

• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

• RSVP only if you seriously plan to attend as space is limited.

How To Get There ...

Take the New York State Thruway to Exit 18 (New Paltz). After paying the toll, turn left onto Route 299 and continue west through the Village of New Paltz. When you cross the bridge over the Wallkill River at the west end of the village, continue ahead on Route 299 (do not turn right towards the Mohonk Mountain House). In another 5.5 miles (from the Wallkill River bridge), Route 299 ends at a T intersection with Route 44/55. Turn right here and follow Route 44/55 as it negotiates a very sharp hairpin turn and climbs to pass under the Trapps Bridge (a steel overpass). Continue for about three miles past the Trapps Bridge to the entrance to Minnewaska State Park, on the left side of the road. A parking fee of $10.00 is charged at the gatehouse. Continue uphill for 0.4 mile to the parking area at Lake Minnewaska, the UPPER one nearest the lake.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where), If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Hiking Gertrude's Nose--A Different Look

results.description:
Sponsored by AQR and Namely, Software Craftsmanship New York presents the Legacy Code Retreat!  

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/536bca85e4b03ee65fcaf178/t/55914bb5e4b0ddd631970c0e/1449069548729/?format=400w

Missed out on the Global Day of Code Retreat but you wanted to go? Or actually you went and want to relive a similar experience?

Come, spend a full day of code crafting with us! 

The venue is going to be in Namely's offices (Thank you, Namely!), breakfast and lunch will be provided, sponsored by AQR Capital LLC (Thank you, AQR!).

The theme will be: dealing with Legacy Code!  

You will learn and practice some very useful techniques to deal with Legacy code. The concepts are typically language agnostic, you can code in any of the most popular languages.

IMPORTANT: Bring your laptop, this is a hands-on session!

What is it? 

A full day of programming exercises that will revolve around working with legacy code.

Why come?

A code retreat is a great opportunity to practice programming without the time pressures or the "getting things done" mentality of our daily lives.

It's also a great chance to program with more experienced developers, teach newcomers, or try a new language.

What should I bring?

A laptop setup with your preferred programming environment.

Anything else that I need to know?

Breakfast and lunch will be provided!

results.description:
COP21 climate talks are underway in Paris. Whatever is decided at the negotiation tables, we need to show our resolve to continue to demand climate justice and a massive transition to renewable energy.
Please join 350NYC, 350BK and 350NJ and allied faith, labor and student groups in "Protect What You Love/Climate Justice Now" at the Statue of Liberty on Saturday December 12,[masked]:15 am-1:00 pm.
Our presence at the Statue of Liberty will send a message to world leaders that we stand together to protect all we hold dear from the threat of catastrophic climate change. As the embodiment of our freedom and liberty, a gift from France as an expression of solidarity with our democratic values, a safe harbor for refugees, and a symbol of hope for people seeking a better life, the Statue of Liberty provides an ideal backdrop for our urgent message.
• We will come dressed wearing green to signify our unified call for climate justice and a swift transition to renewable energy. No wardrobe worries – we will provide green hats and scarves.
• We will take a group photo in front of the Statue of Liberty to be distributed world wide via social media.
• We will share our selfies using: #ProtectWhatYouLove and #ClimateJusticeNow hashtags and invite our friends to do the same from their most beloved places.

At a press conference (1:00 pm in Battery Park, NYC) we will have an opportunity to spell out the consequences of climate change and to articulate our responses to the COP21 talks.

TICKET RESERVATIONS, PAYMENT AND DETAILS HERE: https://cop21-at-liberty-island.eventbrite.com.
We hope to see you on December 12th!
In solidarity,
Marilyn, Dee, Mimi and Rosemary
350NYC, 350BK and 350NJ
P.S. A few important details:
• There will be two departure points: Battery Park, New York City or Liberty State Park in Jersey City. Make sure you order the right ticket!
• Arrive Castle Clinton at 9:15 a.m. Boat departs at 10:00 a.m. (Return by about 1pm) • Tickets cost $14 (Senior) and $18 (Adult) plus Eventbrite administrative fee.
• Getting there: NYC: Take #1 to South Ferry or #4 or 5 to Bowling Green. Jersey City: please use light rail or carpool. Parking fee is $7.00 per car.
• If you need a subsidized ticket(s), please sign up on the “waitlist” in the Eventbrite system, url above. Free tickets will be given in the order of the online list as we are able to raise funds.If you are able to make a donation towards the cost of providing free tickets for those who need them please go to Eventbrite. Thank you and see you on December 12th!

NOTE - Tickets for the Ferry to the Statue of Liberty for the December 12th event "Protect What You Love: Climate Justice Now". will be available at this Grassroots Alliance Meeting on Monday, December 7th. You can pick-up tickets purchased online or make a cash purchase ($18 Adult, $14 Seniors) from 5:30 - 6:30pm on the 5th Floor and after the meeting.
results.name: Protect What you Love: Climate Justice Now at Statue of Liberty

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Sleep is a matter of the mind. It is impossible to force oneself to sleep. One simply has to allow sleep to happen. When mind is relaxed and ready, sleep happens.

The quality of the night time sleep depends on the quality of the day - how stress-free and relaxed the day is. Breathing techniques and meditation relax the body, get rid of stress, calm the mind and slow the incessant flow of thoughts. Thus, they could be great tools for improving the quality of your activity during the day and rest at night.

We will try a breathing technique and guided meditation and see how it help relax the mind and body. We will also share our personal experiences - what helps or hinders sleep.

Hope to see many of you on 11/14.

Cheers,

Sukumar Kavanoor
results.name: Effect of Meditation on Mind and Sleep

results.description:
Studying for the application process at Fullstack Academy or Grace Hopper Academy? Join the workshop that takes you through the coding assessment step-by-step. We'll review the challenges and run through practice problems, answering questions along the way. 

At the end of the session, you'll feel more confident in your skills and be ready to take the next step towards becoming a developer. 

Get a better sense for the application requirements on the Admissions Prep Materials page.

Workshop Agenda

1. Welcome from Instructors

2. Test-taking strategies: tips on how to ace the admissions coding assessment

3. Coding Challenges: attendees will pair up to solve the 5+ problems in 20 minute blocks

4. Each problem will be followed by a 10 minute review to address the solution

5. Attendees will leave the workshop having completed several coding challenges and receive Review Videos

Reminders

• Bring a computer!

• Workshop begins at 10am on Saturday

• We aren't providing a lunch break, so bring snacks to tide you over!

• Please arrive on time to maximize the effectiveness of the workshop

If you are a beginner, we recommend you complete as many of the following units 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 of Codecademy's JavaScript track as possible before Saturday.

Grace Hopper Academy is the world’s first immersive coding school for women where students only pay tuition after securing a job. Our mission is to close the gender gap in technology through high-quality education, mentorship, and need-blind admissions. With a proven curriculum and educational program leveraged from partner school Fullstack Academy, Grace Hopper Academy offers an open environment for women to learn software development and become professional engineers.
